Due to a lack of financial resources, Marta, age 40, didn’t attend school.  Her parents didn’t have enough money to give her an education.  Currently, she is married; her husband works in the capital as a security guard. He only comes home every two weeks because due to his work he can’t spend more time with her and their two children.

Marta has a job as a domestic worker, because since the time she was a girl she has done that type of work.  Since she didn’t have any academic training, she has been obligated to work since she was a girl to support her family with the household expenses.  Besides this, she has a small store that she is just starting.  She hopes to get some extra income for her family with the store.  Her children will work in the store, and she will keep keep working as a maid.

With this loan she will buy a little more merchandise, such as rice, beans, sugar, salt, detergents, and personal care items, to go on expanding her business.  In this way she will be able to have a better profit margin than she currently has.  She will buy more items at a lower price, and the transportation costs will also leave her a little more money, because transporting everything at once will save her money.

She hopes that in the future her children will be people of means with a good education, so that they can establish themselves in the community, have a stable job, and not suffer as she has.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, salt, detergents, personal care items, etc.

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en:
Rachael is a married, 32-year-old woman from Naivasha. They have two children, ages two and seven years old. Rachael has a grinding business that she has been running for the past three years. She has applied for her first loan from Vision Fund Kenya to enable her to buy maize for grinding. Rachael is optimistic that her business will do better after the loan.

She hopes to expand her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy maize for grinding.

loans.name: Gereltuya

texts.en:
Mrs.Gereltuya, 46 years old, lives with her daughter in her apartment in Selenge province, Mongolia. Her daughter, Nomin, is 20 and studies at the university for her Bachelor's diploma. 

Gereltuya has been providing hairdressing services since 1990. She operates her business in a rental workplace and has acquired regular clients over the years. Gereltuya has been supporting her only daughter for years and now most of her profit goes towards her daughter's education fees and other school related expenses. She is a hardworking and responsible woman who is now requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to purchase shampoo, spray and other inventory and to replace some of her tools to continue her business.

loans.use: to purchase shampoo, hair spray and other inventory and to replace some of her tools

loans.name: Viola

texts.en: Viola is a  married woman living in Bien Unido, Bohol. She works with her husband in their fishing business, which is the source of their income. Viola is asking for a loan  to buy fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and floaters. With this, her husband will be able to improve his catch thus giving them more fish to sell in the market.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and floaters

loans.name: Ovgonhuu

texts.en:
Mr. Ovgonhuu is 46 years old and lives with his wife and two children in their house in Selenge province, Mongolia. His wife Bat-Otgon is 48, and helps her husband to run their family business, a butcher's shop. His two daughters are senior students at university and secondary school respectively. 

Ovgonhuu started his butcher shop from his little savings in 2001 with his wife. He has been running the business ever since gaining respect from his clients and providing welcoming services. He has already built close relationships with supplier herders and clients over the years. He is now requesting loan of 5,000,000 MNT to pay his childrens' university tuition and purchase meat products to sell on his rented stall.

loans.use: to pay his children's university tuition and purchase meat products to sell on his rented stall.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 29 years old. She is from Naivasha and is married. They have three children who are between six years and two years old. 

Lucy has a potato business that she has been running for the past three years and has applied for her first loan from VisionFund Kenya to enable her buy more potatoes to add to her stock for sale.

She hopes to expand her business in the near future and to be able to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more potatoes to add to her stock

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 28 years old from Nyahururu. He is married to Grace and they are blessed with a 1-year-old child.

Patrick operates a welding workshop and has been in the business for four years. He earns a monthly income of KES 14,000. He has applied for his third loan of KES 45,000 from VisionFund Kenya. He plans to use his loan to expand his welding business.

He anticipates using the profits to repay his loan and to expand his business. In the future, he hopes to buy a plot.

loans.use: to expand his welding business.

loans.name: Mirriam

texts.en:
Mirriam is 29 years old from Naivasha and is married to Jackson. They have two children who are three years and one year old.

Mirriam has a retail business that she has been running for the past four years and has applied for her first loan from Vision Fund Kenya to enable her buy soft drinks, soaps, sugar, milk and bread to sell. Mirriam will used the profits to boost her business.

She hopes to improve her standards of living in the near future.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks, soaps, sugar, milk and bread.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 52 years old, and is from Nakuru. She is married to Bernard, and they are blessed with four children aged 20, 18, 16 and 14 years old.

She has been running her business of selling livestock for the last twenty-four years, and to enable her to buy some goats for fattening and resale, she has applied for her first loan of KES.20,000 from VisionFund Kenya.

Her monthly income right now is KES. 15,000 and she intends to use the anticipated profits from her expanded business to pay back her loan, educate her children and to buy buy more livestock. In the future, she hopes to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy some goats for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 41 years old, and is from Naivasha. She is married and has four children who are aged between 20 and 13 years old. 

Mary has a livestock business that she has been running for the past ten years. She has applied for her first loan of KES.30,000 to enable her buy another heifer. Mary will use the profits to buy poultry to rear and sell as an additional source of income to add to her business.

She hopes to increase her number of cows in the near future, to help increase her milk production to 100 litres per day.

loans.use: to buy a heifer.

loans.name: Luan

texts.en:
Luan is a 27-year-old father of a 3-year-old child, and he lives in a village where he has been operating a livestock/agriculture activity. The village is not far from a central main city and this makes it easy for the villagers to come down to the city to sell their products. Even though there are farmers markets in almost every city in Albania, not all farmers sell there, because there are far more farmers than booths.

Luan sells milk and other fresh produce, and also every six months he sells the baby calves and goats.
 
This loan will be his first one, and he wants to buy goats and sheep.

loans.use: to buy baby goats and sheep.

loans.name: Abrahan

texts.es:
Abrahan tiene  25 años es soltero y vive en su vivienda hecha a base de adobe junto a sus padres. Se dedica a la agricultura desde muy niño porque creció junto a su familia en el campo rodeado de esta actividad que es catalogada la más popular en su región. Posee 3 hectáreas de terreno dedicados integralmente a la producción de cacao orgánico, café, achiote y frutales.  Dentro de sus principales tareas esta de realizar una serie de mantenimientos a sus diversas plantaciones como es de retirar la maleza que crece constantemente ya que sus terrenos son muy fértiles; además debe realizar  cuidados preventivos contra el ataque de plagas que es el principal riesgo contra su producción. Con le objetivo de obtener ingresos adicionales mientras no posee tareas pendientes en sus terrenos se desempeña como trabajador en otras parcelas realizando labores agrícolas cotidianas. Se siente muy contento ya que en los últimos años ve un crecimiento progresivo de su economía y espera a futuro incrementar aún más al área de sus terrenos para expandir sus plantaciones de cacao orgánico. 
Desea en esta oportunidad contar con 3,000 nuevos soles para realizar en las próximas semanas la cosecha de sus productos; asimismo preparar posteriormente sus terrenos de cultivo para iniciar otra campaña productiva con la compra de abonos orgánico y almácigo.
texts.en:
Abrahan is 25 years old. He is single and lives with his parents in their home made of adobe. He has worked in agriculture since he was a very little boy, because he grew up with his family in the country, surrounded by this activity, which is categorized as the most common in his region. He has three hectares of land dedicated completely to the production of organic cacao, coffee, achiote, and fruit. Among his principal tasks is to complete a series of maintenance operations on his various plantations, such as pulling out the weeds that grow constantly since his plots are very fertile. In addition, he has to take preventative care against attacks of diseases that are the principal risks to his production. With the goal of obtaining additional income when he doesn't have pending tasks on his land, he works as a laborer on other farms, doing daily agricultural work. He feels very happy since in the last few years he has seen a progressive growth in his economy, and he hopes in the future to increase the area of his land even more in order to expand his plantings of organic cacao.

At this time he wants to have 3000 PEN to harvest his crops in the coming weeks and later to prepare his cultivated land to begin another production season with the purchase of organic compost and seedlings.

loans.use: to buy organic compost and seedlings

loans.name: Maximo

texts.es:
La Sr. Máximo tiene 50 años,  es de la Ciudad de Paraguarí, es olero hace más de 10 años también tiene una despensa bien surtida en su casa que emprendió hace 1 año aproximadamente.
Es una persona muy trabajadora, está casado con la Señora María de 38 años, y juntos tienen 3 hijos por quienes luchan para poder darles una vida digna.
Pide de este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para poder surtir su despensa, como ser bebidas, carne, verduras, embutidos y demás insumos para poder seguir con sus ventas y de esa forma poder ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
Maximo is 50 years old and from the town of Paraguari.  He has been a boot black for 10 years and also has a well-stocked grocery store in his home that he started about a year ago.

He is a hardworking person, married to 38 year old Maria, and they have three children for whom they strive to provide a dignified life

He is asking for this loan to buy supplies, such as beverages, meats, vegetables, sausages, and other things to stock his store and continue making sales so he can help his family.

loans.use: to stock his store.

loans.name: Lourdes Raquel

texts.es: Lourdes de 26 años de edad es una joven emprendedora y trabajadora quien se gana la vida trabajando como asistente contable en una empresa cercana a su localidad. Desea mejorar sus condiciones habitaciones y las de su familia por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la instalación de la luz eléctrica y para repellar las paredes de la vivienda. Con el crédito comprará cemento, arena y pagará por la instalación de la luz eléctrica.
texts.en: Lourdes is 26 years old and a young hardworking entrepreneur who earns a living as an accountant’s assistant at a nearby local firm.  She wants to improve her living conditions for herself and her family and is asking for this loan through FUSAI to install electricity and plaster the walls in her home.  She will use the money from this loan to buy cement, sand, and pay for installation of electricity.

loans.use: to install electricity.

loans.name: Luz Omaira

texts.es:
Luz es una mujer pujante y luchadora, cabeza de hogar desde que se separó de su esposo, tiene a cargo a sus dos hijos adolescentes a quienes ha sacado adelante con gran esfuerzo.
Se desempeña como comerciante independiente, inició vendiendo productos por catálogo, gracias a que una amiga le enseñó la labor, pero luego, con el ánimo de generar mejores ingresos, decidió iniciar su propia tienda de abarrotes, aprovechando la ventaja de ser conocida en el sector por su actividad anterior, trabaja sola todos los días de 7:00 am a 8:00 pm, allí ofrece diferentes productos de la canasta familiar y ha logrado generar ingresos para pagar los estudios de sus hijos y para el sustento diario.
El propósito con el crédito es comprar una vitrina exhibidora y fortalecer su inventario con productos lácteos, carnes frías, huevos, granos, mecato, entre otros, para satisfacer la demanda actual y poder ofrecer más variedad de artículos a su clientela, mejorando las ventas y los ingresos que recibe.
Luz tiene como meta a corto plazo, independizar su negocio de la unidad familiar, para lo que está trabajando en pro de conseguir un local más amplio y que le permita tener más capacidad para aumentar los inventarios, generando una mayor rentabilidad y estabilidad económica que le permita seguir apoyando a sus hijos y darles una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Luz is a vivacious, hard-working woman. She has been the head of her household since separating from her husband. She has custody of her two adolescent children whom she has gotten ahead through great hard work.
Luz is an independent merchant. She started off selling products through a catalogue thanks to a friend who taught her this work. Later, with a desire to generate a better income, she decided to start her own grocery store. She took advantage of being known in the area from her previous business. She works alone every day from 7 am to 8 pm, offering various grocery products. She has been able to generate an income to pay for her children's studies and to provide their daily bread.
Her goal for this loan is to buy a display case and strengthen her inventory with dairy products, cold meats, eggs, grains, pastries, and other items in order to satisfy current demand and to offer a greater variety of articles to her customers. This will improve her sales and income.
Luz's short-term goal is to make her business independent from her family. She is working in order to obtain a larger storefront that will allow her to have a greater capacity to increase her inventory, generating greater profitability and economic stability which will allow her to continue to help her children and provide them with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a display case and increase her inventory with dairy products, cold meats, eggs, grains, pastries, and other items.

loans.name: Anvar

texts.en: Anvar, 25 years old, is a young and purposeful man. He is not married and lives with his parents, brother and sister in a rural area. For more than 5 years, Anvar has been growing melons, watermelons, wheat, potatoes, etc. Since he began this business, the family's living conditions have improved. Anvar likes his job. He thinks that growing vegetables is the best way for earning money in Tajikistan. He is going to make a new sowing. Anvar is asking for a loan of 4,000 somoni (TJS) to buy mineral fertilizers and seeds. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy mineral fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Yelen

texts.en:
Yelen is a married woman and has two children aged 8 and 6 years old. They live in Bien Unido, Bohol, Philippines. Yelen works with her husband in their fishing business.

Yelen is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, floaters and other fishing materials. With this, her husband will be able to enhance his catch, thus allowing him to sell more fish in the market.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, floaters and other fishing materials.

loans.name: Jovanni

texts.es:
Jovanni es un campesino de 43 años de edad, padre de 3 hijos, a los que ha sacado adelante con mucho esfuerzo.
Desde que era muy niño ha adquirido conocimientos sobre el manejo de la tierra y el cuidado de los animales, ya que en su familia ha sido una tradición y ha pasado de generación en generación; gracias a ello, hoy en día su actividad generadora de ingresos es la cría y comercialización de ganado porcino; el cual vende en pie o por kilos, según los requerimientos de sus clientes; así ha logrado generar recursos para solventar los gastos de su familia.
El crédito lo solicita como apoyo para fortalecer su negocio, pues desea comprar lechones y concentrado para alimentar a los animales, así podrá aprovechar la temporada decembrina para aumentar su producción y sus ventas, ya que se incrementa el consumo de este tipo de carne; mejorando notablemente la entrada de recursos familiares.
Jovanni es un hombre soñador y se proyecta para un futuro cercano, teniendo más ganado tanto lechero como porcino, así podrá incursionar en mercados diferentes y mejorará la estabilidad económica de la familia, para ofrecer a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida y una educación de calidad para que se forjen un futuro más próspero y exitoso.
texts.en:
Jovanni is a 43-year-old farmer and father of three. He has gotten his children ahead through great hard work.
Ever since he was a small boy, he has been gaining knowledge of how to work the land and care for animals. This has been a tradition in his family passed down from generation to generation. Thanks to this, today his job is raising and selling hogs. He sells them by the animal or by the kilo, based on his clients' requirements. This is how he has generated an income to cover his family's costs.
He is requesting this loan as a support to strengthen his business. He wants to buy suckling pigs and concentrate to feed his animals. This way, he will be able to take advantage of the December season in order to increase his production and sales; consumption of this type of meat is increasing. This will improve his family income.
Jovanni is a dreamer and hopes in the near future to have more livestock; pigs and cows. This will allow him to enter into different markets and will improve his family's economic stability. This will allow him to offer his children a greater quality of life and a quality education so that they can shape a more prosperous and successful future for themselves.

loans.use: to buy suckling pugs and concentrate to feed his animals.

loans.name: Artemia

texts.en:
Artemia is 54 years old and lives in Matugas Bajo, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 4 children. 

Artemia had earned her living from her parcel of cocoland and from her little sari-sari store inside her house in which she earns an approximate amount of not less than PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to be used in redeeming a parcel of cocoland which was pawned to their neighbor. 

Artemia has been a member of PMPC for almost 6 years.  In the future Artemia hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to be used in redeeming a parcel of cocoland

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 53 years old, married to Gilbert, and a mother of six children. She has a dairy farm, and also a transport business. She has been involved in these businesses for twenty years now, and gets monthly income of KES 74,000.

This will be Catherine's sixth loan with VisionFund Kenya. She plans to use the entire loan to purchase spare parts for the lorry, and also to take the lorry for a service. In the future, she wants to be a prosperous businesswoman and educate one of her children, who is in college.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the lorry.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 39 years old, and is from Kisumu, which is located in the western part of Kenya. He takes care of his family together with his wife, and supports six people in the family.

Joseph sells second hand clothes in the markets within Kisumu Municipality, a business he has been doing for the last five years. He gets a monthly income of KES.25,000. He hopes to make his business become stable.

He has now taken his fifth loan with Vision Fund Kenya, which he will use to pay school fees for his children. Joseph's dream is to educate his children and have a stable source of income.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Liliana

texts.es: Liliana tiene 14 años de experiencia en su peluquería propia, pues desde muy joven le gustó ser independiente, no obstante cuando estudió belleza, emprendió su propia aventura de negocios. Hoy ha construido una clientela, trabajando 12 horas diarias, de lunes a domingos sin cesar y por ello ha logrado adicionar formas de obtener ingresos, mediante la asesoría sobre productos que mejoran la imagen de sus clientes y la venta de estos de acuerdo a las necesidades y posibilidades de cada uno. Su meta mas adelante es tener un local propio y su vivienda propia, para que sus hijos tengan cada vez mas bienestar. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará un aire acondicionado, para ofrecer un ambiente confortable a su clientela, para ambientar su peluquería en esta cálida ciudad del caribe de brisa, arena sol y mar .
texts.en: Liliana has 14 years of experience in her own beauty salon, because since she was very young she liked to be self employed. After studying to be a beauty styler she started her own business. Nowadays, she has built a clientele by working 12 hours a day, from Monday to Sunday, without breaks. She has also been able to add to her income by recommending beauty products to improve her customers' images; products that fulfill their needs and are affordable to them. Her goal is to own her salon and house, so that her children have a better life. Currently she is requesting a credikiva loan, her first request, to the Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo so that she can buy an air conditioning unit. With it she will offer a more comfortable environment to her customers and improve her beauty salon in this warm Caribbean city of breeze, sand, sun and sea.

loans.use: to buy an air conditioning unit

loans.name: Ledis Esther

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Ledis en su negocio de artesanias pues con su credikiva logró comprar materiales con los cuales elaboró lindas figuras en foamy., con las cuales incrementó sus ingresos y el de su familia. Ella dice a sus finaciadores de Kiva: " Muchos agradecimeintos a Kiva y a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, y solicito seguir apoyandome. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo financiamiento mediante el cual comprará materias primas e insumos de foamy y mercancias variadas, ajustadas a la temporada escxolar que inicia, comoo cuadernos, lapices, boligrados, cartulinas, goma, colores, temperas etc. con ello mejorará su respuerta a la clientela y ganará un poco mas.
texts.en: Ledis gives thanks for the support in her craft business, because with her Kiva loan she was able to purchase supplies. With the supplies she made beautiful figures in foam, with which she increased her own income as well as her family's. She tells her Kiva lenders, "Many thanks to Kiva and to Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, and I ask for your continued support". She's currently applying for a new loan which she'll use to purchase supplies for foam crafts and an assortment of merchandise for the upcoming school season, such as notebooks, pencils, ballpoint pens, cardboard, glue, crayons, temperas, etc. That way she'll improve her service towards her customers and make a little more profit.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for foam crafts and an assortment of merchandise for the upcoming school season, such as notebooks, pencils, ballpoint pens, cardboard, glue, crayons, temperas, etc.

loans.name: Beth

texts.en:
Beth is a 55-year-old married woman. She has five children. She describes herself as determined. She operates a farm where she keeps dairy cows which produce milk which is sold. She also keeps poultry which produce eggs which are sold. She has been involved in this business for 14 years. Her business is located in an area with potential and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds.

She will use the KES 100,000 loan to buy a deep freezer. This will enable her store milk as she waits to sell it. Her business goal is to be the main supplier of milk in her area within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her business and educate her children. This is her fourth loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loans of KES 100,000 were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to improve her business and also repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy a deep freezer.

loans.name: Saydaly

texts.en:
Saydaly is kind man from a rural area. He is married and has two children.

Saydaly has had his own business with animal husbandry for more than four years. He feeds cows and sheep. Saydaly has a good opportunity to develop his business with animal husbandry because he lives in the village. The only source of income is from animal husbandry. 

Saydaly is going to increase his working capital. He is asking for a loan of TJS 15,000 (somoni) to buy cattle. This loan will help him to develop business and, in this way, to maximize profit. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy cattle to sell.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is married with three children. She is 57 years old and lives in San Vicente, Sinacaban, Philippines. Gloria sells assorted goods to earn a living and has had this business for one year. Each month, she earns PHP 3,000 doing this type of work. 

She has requested a loan for PHP 14,900 to restock her store with basic commodities. Gloria has been a member of PMPC for five years.  In the future, she hope to save for future emergencies.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities

loans.name: Enhjargal

texts.en:
Mrs. Enhjargal, 23 years old, lives with her husband and 2 sons, aged 1 and 4, in their small house in Selenge province, Mongolia. Her husband, Tortogtoh, works at a local TV broadcaster. 

Enhjargal started her hairdressing business in a rental place in 2011, after she graduated from a specialized hairdresser training course. She is already well known among clients with her friendly, gentle and tasteful service. After having given birth to her son,  Enhjargal is now going back to work and needs 2,000,000 MNT to purchase necessary inventory and tools to continue providing her barber shop service.

loans.use: to purchase necessary inventory and tools to continue providing her barber shop service

loans.name: Mishi

texts.en:
Mishi is married and has four children who attend school. She lives in a rental house that has piped water and electricity. She cites school fees and food as her greatest monthly expenses.

Mishi has operated a beauty salon business for the past three years. Her potential customers are her fellow neighbors and people at the market place. Mishi dreams of earning more income and incorporating hairdressing skills in the future. 

Mishi plant to use this KES 50,000 loan to purchase chemicals and air conditioners for her beauty salon business. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase chemicals and air conditioners for her beauty salon business

loans.name: Lavdije

texts.en:
Lavdije is requesting a loan to buy a taxi vehicle for her husband; the one he had has broken down and cannot be fixed anymore.

Lavdije is 45 years old and has three children. She is a stay-at-home mother, and in addition she does agriculture and livestock work. Her husband has been running his taxi business and also has been working in a restaurant at the same time. They live in a village that under the communist era was considered a picturesque place to visit. What made this place a good one to visit or spend the weekends with your family for a picnic was that there are some centuries-old oak trees and beneath them, there is some water coming like a whirlpool. It was beautiful then, yet not any longer, unfortunately.

loans.use: to purchase a taxi vehicle for her husband.

loans.name: Mariga

texts.en:
Mariga is widowed with four children who have finished school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. 

She operates a cashewnuts business, selling at the market and to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Her dream is to establish another business in the near future. 

With the loan of KES. 10,000 she wants to purchase sacks of cashewnuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of cashewnuts to re-sell.

loans.name: Mab

texts.en:
Mab is 52 years old, a widowed mother of five children, and a villager from the Ou Dong district of Kampong Speu province. Now, only four children are still under her responsibility and all of them are in school. Two are in high school and two remain in university. 

To feed the family, she grows rice as the main source of income and sells some grocery items for additional income. She has been doing this for 34 years and it has returned her around $9 per day. 

She is in the first cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Now, she is seeking an education loan to cover school fees for her son who desires to study accounting. She hopes her son will have a good job and get a high salary to support family’s living better after he graduates.

loans.use: To cover her son's school fees

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Ou Dong District

loans.name: Gladis Olinda

texts.es: Gladis tiene 53 años de edad y vive junto a su esposo, su madre y hermanos. Gladys se dedica a la venta de ropa y cosméticos, además en su humilde vivienda da los servicios de masajes solo para damas. Ella ha solicitado un préstamo a FUSAI para reparar la estructura del techo y cambiar la cubierta ya que por el tiempo que tiene ya está muy deteriorado. Con el dinero del préstamo va a comprar la madera de pino, lámina galvanizada y clavos para lámina. Gladis dice que solventará su deuda según el plazo establecido.
texts.en: Gladis is 53 years old and lives with her husband, mother, and siblings.  Gladys sells clothing and cosmetics.  She is from a humble home and provides massages for women only.  She is asking for a loan through FUSAI to repair her roof and change out the cover because it’s much deteriorated.  She will use the money from this loan to buy pine, galvanized metal and nails.  Gladys says that she will repay the debt on time.

loans.use: to repair her roof.

loans.name: Mauricio Enrique

texts.es: Mauricio de 20 años de edad es un joven muy emprendedor, actualmente está trabajando como ayudante de albañil y en poco tiempo desea ser un buen obrero en el oficio de la construcción. Mauricio ha solicitado un crédito a FUSAI ya que desea reparar el techo de humilde vivienda. El dinero lo invertirá únicamente en los materiales de construcción; como la madera, clavos, lámina galvanizada. Mauricio será quien realice las obras de reparación y desea dejar las puertas abiertas con la Institución así más adelante obtener otro crédito y seguir mejorando su vivienda.
texts.en: Mauricio is 20 years old and a young entrepreneur who currently works as a mason’s helper and wants to be a good construction worker soon.  Mauricio has requested a loan through FUSAI because he wants to repair the roof on his humble home.  He will use the money to buy building materials such as lumber, nails, and galvanized metal.  Mauricio will do the work himself and wants to leave the doors open with the institution so he can get other loans in the future and continue improving his home.

loans.use: to repair his roof.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 50-year-old single mother of two children. She has operated a dairy farming business in Kiambu for nine years, earning a monthly income of 30,000 KES.

This will be Jane's second loan from VisionFund Kenya. She plans to use the entire loan to buy animal feed. Jane wants to educate her children and become a prosperous businesswoman in the future.

loans.use: to buy animal feed

loans.name: Ulziijargal

texts.en: Mr. Ulziijargal is a Bachelor's degree student who studies in a private university in government management. He has mentioned that there was no chance to pay for tuition fees for this year and he was really happy to study this year. He is graduating in June 2014, so getting a job and supporting his family is his short term goal. Mr.Ulziijargal is a very hardworking and well-known student at his university.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees

loans.name: Kea's Group

texts.en:
Kea is a resident from Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province. She is 46 years old and a mother of four children, one of whom is in school. To strive for a living, she and her husband do rice cropping and cucumber planting as the main sources of income. She has been with this business for 26 years and it has returned her around 33,000 KHR per day. 

She has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for ages, with a successful repayment of the past four loans . It has helped her family with sufficient food for her household. Now, she is the leader of her group, consisting of two borrowers, requesting a new loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner).  She is in her fifth loan cycle with while her group member is borrowing for the first time. 

Now,the total amount of her group request loan amount is 2,400,000 KHR, of which 1,400,000 KHR is her loan portion. As the group leader, she will use her entire loan portion to pay for the land leasing fee to grow her cucumbers. She hopes her business will return her a good yield with a good income.

loans.use: To pay for the land leasing fee to grow her cucumbers.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Ana Delmy

texts.es: Ana de 32 años de edad está acompañada y tiene 3 hijos todos menores de edad. Ana tiene una pequeña tienda y tortillería en su vivienda. Para mantener mayor seguridad y proteger las pocas pertenencias, su esposo y Ana han decidido levantar un tapial al frente de su vivienda, además parte de la cubierta del techo está deteriorado y cambiarán algunas láminas; por esa razón Ana ha solicitado un crédito a FUSAI para comprar la arena, grava, cemento, ladrillo de barro para levantar el tapial y la lámina, madera y clavos para sustituir parte de la cubierta de techo de su vivienda. Con el apoyo de esposo solventará la deuda que el crédito implica.
texts.en: Ana is 32 years old, married, and has three young children.  Ana has a small store and tortilla shop in her home.  In order to be safe and protect the few things they have, her husband and Ana have decided to build a wall in front of the house and the roof is deteriorated so they will change out some metal.  Ana is asking for this loan through FUSAI to buy sand, gravel, cement, brick for the wall, lumber, and nails to replace part of the roof.  With her husband’s help, she will pay off the debt.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Yesenia Cesibel

texts.es:
Yesenia de 24 años de edad, es una joven luchadora,  a pesar  de ser una madre soltera ha podido salir adelante con su pequeña hija. Pudiendo estudiar, solamente hasta séptimo grado, no siendo este un obstáculo para superarse, decidió capacitarse  en la cosmetología, teniendo así oportunidades de buscar trabajo o establecer su propio negocio (sala de belleza). Ella vive actualmente en la casa de sus padres, pero quiere independizarse  y esto lo puede lograr  teniendo una fuente de ingresos permanente.


Actualmente se dedica a la venta de ropa casa por casa y por pedidos, también ofrece tratamientos de belleza de una manera informal, para ocasiones especiales como bodas, quince años, entre otras actividades. En la venta de ropa tiene 5 años de experiencia y este oficio, simplemente tuvo la iniciativa y poco a poco fue mejorando la técnica de venta, tanto así que ha conseguido la fidelidad de algunos clientes. Su mercado es en todo el cantón y sus alrededores.  La ropa la compra en la capital del país cada 15 días.


El préstamo lo necesita para  la compra de material de construcción (ladrillos, arena, cemento, hierro, etc),  esto le va servir para la construcción de una pequeña tienda, donde venderá ropa y brindara servicios de belleza,( cortes, tintes de cabello, peinados, entre otros. con este local ella podrá tener su negocio  obteniendo  ingresos y cuidar a su pequeña alavés 


Su sueño es tener su negocio bien establecido (formal) haciendo,  este oficio que lo disfruta  realizándolo y  poder darle a su hija los cuidados que le permitan desarrollarse sana y prepararse académicamente.
texts.en:
24 year old Yesenia is a young fighter, in spite of being a single mother she has been able to go on with her young daughter. Being able to only study until seventh grade, this has not been an obstacle to outdo herself, decided to train in cosmetology, therefore having opportunities to look for work or establish her own business (beauty salon). She currently lives in her parents' house, but she would like to become independent which she can accomplish by having a permanent source of income. 

Currently she is dedicated to the sale of clothing, both door to door and by order, she also offers beauty treatments informally, for special occasions such as weddings and "quince años" (a girl's fifteenth birthday, which is an important turning point), among others. She has 5 years of experience selling clothes. For this profession she simply took the initiative and little by little she bettered her sale technique, so much so that she has gotten the loyalty of some clients. Her market is in all of the neighborhood and the surrounding area. She buys the clothing in the capital of the country every 15 days. 

She needs this loan in order to buy the construction material (bricks, sand, cement, iron, etc), which will help her with the construction of a small store, where she will sell clothing and offer beauty treatments (hair cuts, coloring, and styling among others). With this shop she will be able to have her business, gaining income and be able to take care of her little girl at the same time. 

Su sueño es tener su negocio bien establecido (formal) haciendo,  este oficio que lo disfruta  realizándolo y  poder darle a su hija los cuidados que le permitan desarrollarse sana y prepararse académicamente.

Her dream is to have her business well-established formally, doing this trade that she enjoys carrying out, and to be able to give to her daughter the care that allows her to grow healthily and prepare academically.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (bricks, sand, cement, iron, etc), which will help her with the construction of a small store where she will sell clothing and give beauty services (hair cuts, coloring and styling among others)

loans.name: Bahodir

texts.en:
Bahodir is a successful businessman who lives in a rural area. Bahodir is 46 years old. He is married and has two children. Bahodir has been busy with animal husbandry for more than nine years. His experience and abilities help him to further develop his business. He works hard because he needs money to provide his family with all the necessary things. 

Bahodir is going to increase the number of his cattle and, in this way, attract more customers. He is asking for a loan of TJS 7,500 (somoni) to buy cattle. He awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy cattle to sell.

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.es:
Rogelio es un joven campesino de 20 años de edad, que se ha dedicado desde muy temprana edad, a realizar las diversas labores del campo; aprendió de sus padres y gracias a ello, hoy en día se dedica a la cría y comercialización de cerdos, los cuales vende por kilos o en pie, según la necesidad de sus clientes; así logra generar recursos para llevar el sustento a su hogar en el que convive con su esposa.
El crédito que solicita es una alternativa para fortalecer el negocio, pues requiere adecuar el espacio para tener más cerdos, ya que tiene una hembra en período de gestación y además desea comprar más lechones, con lo que podrá satisfacer la demanda que se incrementa en esta temporada decembrina, debido a las tradiciones antioqueñas, que hacen que el consumo de carne de cerdo se incremente durante esta época; esto le dará la opción de recibir mejores ingresos para su familia.
Rogelio, es un hombre con proyección y ambición, por lo que desea seguir luchando para tener una gran marranera, que le permita ser reconocido y le dé  la posibilidad de mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Rogelio is a young 20-year-old farmer who as worked from a very early age to accomplish different kinds of work out in the countryside.  He learned from his parents and thanks to that these days he works raising and selling pigs, which he sells by the kilo or by the foot, according to the needs of his clients.  This way he is able to earn an income to support his home which he shares with his wife.

The loan he is requesting is an alternative to support his business, as it requires adjusting his area to have more pigs, since he has a female in its gestation period and also wants to buy some piglets so that he can satisfy the increasing demands during this holiday season: Due to old traditions the consumption of pork goes up during this period; this will give him the option of receiving a better income for his family.

Rogelio is a forward-looking man with ambition because what he wants is to keep working hard to have big pig pen, allowing him to become known and giving him the possibility to improve his family's life conditions.

loans.use: make adjustments to the area to have more pigs and piglets

loans.name: Norwin Yareth

texts.es: Norwin Yareth: Es un joven con iniciativa, amable, es casado con un pequeño hijo de 7 meses. Desde hace año y medio estableció su pulpería, comenzó vendiendo verduras. Ha venido creciendo con los ingresos percibidos y los créditos que ha recibido de PANA PANA, ahora cuenta con una pequeña miscelánea, localizada en el mercado de la Ciudad de Bilwi. Solicita nuevamente financiamiento para incrementar su inventario en los siguientes productos: Leche en polvo en bolsa y tarros, salsas de tomate, sopas instantáneas, galletas, jugos, cereales, jabones, detergente, comida para mascota y granos básicos. Su sueño es construir su  vivienda de dos pisos, para que en el primer piso tenga mayor espacio su negocio.
texts.en:
Norwin Yareth is a young man with initiative, is friendly and is married with a 7 month old son. 

A year and a half ago he established his grocery store, beginning with the sale of vegetables. His business has grown with its earned income and loans that he has received from PANA PANA. Now he has a small general store located in the market of the city of Bilwi.

He asks for funding again to increase his inventory in the following products: powdered milk in bag and jars, tomato sauces, instant soups, cookies, juices, cereals, soaps, detergent, pet food and basic grains. 

His dream is to build a two-story house so that on the first floor he will have more room for his business.

loans.use: para incrementar su inventario en los siguientes productos: Leche en polvo en bolsa y tarros, salsas de tomate, sopas instantáneas, galletas, jugos, cereales, jabones, detergente, comida para mascota y granos básicos.

loans.name: Avdyl

texts.en: Avdyl is in need of your financial help; he has been told that he needs stomach surgery, but the procedure hasn’t yet been scheduled yet because he lacks the money to help him cover the medical expenses. This will be the first time for Avdyl to apply for a loan; until now he has maintained good health, which, according to him comes as a result of breathing fresh air in the village and eating organic foods with plenty of protein, vegetables, fruit and home-made dairy products. Avdyl is the father of eight children, and he has been focused on his agriculture/livestock activity for nearly twenty years. Like the others who undertake similar activities, he has been selling the products beside the national road, where he has built a little primitive booth.

loans.use: to pay for his stomach surgery.

loans.name: Dalgy

texts.es:
Dalgi de 46 años de edad vive en el municipio de Soledad a 10 minutos de la ciudad con su cónyuge y tiene dos hijas en las edades de 28 a 30 años. Al llegar de su pueblo natal vivió con su tía quien tenía una tienda, en el año 1980. Posteriormente Dalgi decidió vender productos fritos, y en el punto en el que se ubicó despertó una gran acogida. Por eso agregó caldos, comidas corrientes, posteriormente compró una infraestructura compuesta por un mesón, menaje de cocina y estufa y finalmente consiguió una infraestructura completa con cocina industrial, que compro a buen precio, pues su dueño quebró. Así transcurrió su primera experiencia de negocio, que le dio bases para aspirar a montar otras microempresas en un país vecino y al final regresar a la ciudad de Barranquilla, comprar su vivienda y emprender una nueva aventura pero con mejores bases en su país natal. En la actualidad está dedicada a la venta de mercancía variada, mediante guias especializadas de productos, especialmente cosméticos y también productos naturales y multiusos. Su mayor desafío es no tener el suficiente capital de trabajo, para lograr la potencialidad de su crecimiento. 
Su anterior credito con la Fundación Mraio Santo Domingo,lo invirtió en su nuevo negocio de servicios de alquiler de maquinas lavadoras y hasta le alcanzó para comprar  mercancía variada, que vendió oportunamente, aumentando su liquidez, logró mayores ventas, mas clientela  y sus utilidades mejoraron. Por eso satisfecha por estos logros está aplicando a un credikiva, mediante el cual comprará nuevas lavadoras, que modernizarán su negocio y ampliaran la clientela, y mucha mercancía, para responder a sus clientes fijos y ocasionales. Ella envía sus “agradecimientos a los financiadores de Kiva y a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, y espero seguir contando con este importante apoyo para continuar fortaleciendo su negocio de comercio y alquiler de lavadoras. “
texts.en:
Dalgi is 46 years old. She lives 10 minutes away from the town of Soledad with her spouse. She has two daughters aged 28 and 30 years. When she arrived from her hometown, she lived with an aunt who owned a store in the year 1980. Later on, Dalgi decided to sell fried foods, and she was very well-received at the venue she set up. For that reason she added broths and meals. Then later on she bought amenities comprised of a counter, kitchenware and a stove. She finally obtained fully equipped amenities with an industrial kitchen, which she bought at a good price because the previous owner went bankrupt. That's how her first business experience went. It laid the foundation for her to aspire to set up other small businesses in a neighboring country. She ultimately returned to the town of Barranquilla, bought her house and started a new venture in her home country, but on better grounds. She currently sells various merchandise from specialized product catalogs, especially cosmetics and also natural and multipurpose products. Her biggest challenge is not having enough working capital to successfully achieve her growth potential.
Her previous loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo was used for her new business renting washing machines. It was even enough for her to purchase various merchandise, which she eventually sold. This increased her liquidity and she had more sales, more customers, and improved her profits. That's why she's pleased with these achievements and is applying for a Kiva loan. With it she'll purchase new washing machines, which will modernize her business and expand her clientele, as well as a lot of merchandise so she can meet the orders from her regular and occasional customers. She gives her "thanks to Kiva lenders and to Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, and I hope to keep on counting on this important support in order to continue strengthening the sales and the washer rental business".

loans.use: to purchase washing machines and a large assortment of merchandise, so she can meet the orders from her regular and occasional customers.

loans.name: Saren

texts.en: Saren is a 46-year-old villager from the Memot district of the Kampong Cham province. She is also a widowed mother of six children. To feed the family, she has been rubber farming about two and half hectares of farmland as her main source of income. She works as a paid worker to supplement her income. She has been with this business for ages. This is the first loan for Saren with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Now, she is seeking an education loan to cover the school fees for her son who wants to study law. She hopes her son will find a good job and will be a good human resource for the sake of the country.

loans.use: To pay the school fees for her son who wants to study law.

loans.name: Marta Jaqueline

texts.es:
Marta de 49 años de edad, es una mujer muy emprendedora la cual aprendió el oficio de sastre hace 12 años, hoy en día ella se dedica a hacer mosquiteros, camisas, costuras y cualquier arreglo que necesiten sus clientes, los cuales son del mismo lugar, a pesar de vivir sin esposo ella es muy  luchadora y busca la manera de poder obtener ingresos mediante su oficio, para poder aportar un poco a su hija la cual está estudiando una carrera universitaria.


Marta a pesar de haber aprendió, este oficio de su mamá la cual le enseño muy bien, Marta se encuentra agradecida porque ya tiene 12 años de experiencia y mucha gente la conoce y recomienda como una buena sastre del lugar, su trabajo lo desempeña en su casa donde se acercan a hacerle los pedidos. 

Con el préstamo Marta comprara material  como tela, hilos, zipperes, broches, etc. para seguir trabajando, debido a que por el momento tiene una demanda constante dentro de la zona, con esto mejorara su fuente de ingresos provenientes del negocio.

En un futuro quiere ser una persona con un negocio lo suficientemente grande, donde no le falte producto para cumplir la necesidad de las personas de la zona, con los ingresos que obtenga podrá ayudarle en los gastos del estudio a su hija, quien está estudiando una carrera universitaria y necesita el apoyo de su madre.
texts.en:
Marta is 49 years old and is a very enterprising woman. 12 years ago she learned to tailor, and today she is dedicated to making mosquito nets, shirts, seams, and doing whatever repair her clients need, who are from the same place. In spite of living without a husband, she is very courageous and is looking for the way to be able to obtain income through her position. This way she can provide a little to her daughter who is studying in university. 

Marta, despite having learned this position from her mother, who taught her very well, finds herself grateful because she already has 12 years of experience and many people know and recommend her as a good tailor. She carries out her work at home where people go make their requests.  

With the loan Marta will buy material, such as yarn, needles, zippers and clasps in order to continue working, since at the moment she has a constant demand within the area. With this she will improve the source of income coming from her business. 

In the future she wants to be a person with a sufficiently large business, where she is not missing products that are important to meet the demand of the people in the area. With the income that she obtains she will be able to help her daughter with the costs of her studies. Her daughter is completing a university career and needs her mother's support.

loans.use: to buy yarn, needles, zippers and clasps in order to continue working.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is a married woman from San Miguel, Bohol. For more than four years now she has sold fruit to make an income.

As of now, Imelda is applying for a 6,000 PHP loan through CEVI to buy more bananas, pineapples and other fruits to sell. With these she will be able to sell more and add to her income.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to sell

loans.name: Hurma

texts.en:
Hurma, whose name in English means "persimmon," is a widowed mother of three children who has worked hard to raise them. “It was not easy at all, but then you get into a routine and you don’t mind the hard work or loneliness anymore,” said Hurma.

The village where Hurma and her children reside is located in an elevated area and the roads are very bad because they are unpaved and bumpy. However, when you arrive there, the locale features beautiful scenery. 

Hurma wants to buy a dairy cow. This will be her first loan.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Yean

texts.en: Yean is a resident from the Koh Sotin district of the Kampong Cham province. She is 60 years old and a mother of eight children. Currently, only two kids are under her responsibility; one is in school and the other is helping the family’s business. To support her family, she has been planting tobacco  for her main source of income for 40 years. She earns about $8 per day. Now, Yean is a first-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she is applying for an education loan to cover the school fees for her son who wants to pursue a bachelor's degree. She hopes that her son will find a good job after he graduates and earn a decent income to support his family.

loans.use: To pay the school fees for her son who wants to earn a bachelor's degree.

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Nary

texts.en:
Nary is a resident of Kandal Stoeng district of Kandal province. She is a 39-year-old mother of three dependent children who are still in school. To make a living, she and her husband do pig–raising business as their main source of income and grow rice on one hectare of farmland to supplement their income. She has been with this for twenty years and it has improved her family’s living conditions at a gradual pace. 

This is the first time for Nary borrowing with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is requesting an education loan and plans to use her entire loan to cover her daughter’s school fees. Her daughter wants to pursue a Bachelor's degree, majoring in Nursery. She hopes her daughter will successfully graduate with this degree and get a good job after graduation.

loans.use: To cover her daughter’s school fees

loans.name: Las Ñustas De Quillarumiyoc Group

texts.es:
La socia Celia pertenece al banco comunal LAS ÑUSTAS DE QUILLARUMIYOC, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Ancahuasi,provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.
La socia tiene 30 años de edad es casada y tiene 01 hijo, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza de animales menores, la socia cría a estos animalitos para luego venderlos en las ferias que se realiza por la zona, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de cuyes para su negocio.
Los demás socios se dedican a la construccion, agricultura, trabajos en madera, tejidos, venta de ganados, maestro de obra.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en: The partner Celia belongs to the communal bank  LAS ÑUSTAS DE QUILLARUMIYOC, a bank located in the district of Ancahuasi, Anta province, department of Cusco. The partner is 30 years old, married and has a son. The partner combines her daily activities with the business of raising small animals. The partner raises these small animals to sell them later at festivities that are held around her region. The partner has been working in this busines for a long time, and it is going well thanks to her daily efforts. The partner wants to keep on working so that she can continue supporting her family. The partner requests a loan to buy guinea pigs for her business. The other partners work in construction, agriculture, woodworking, woven textiles, cattle sale, or as master builders. The partner is grateful for the given loan and promises to pay it back on time.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs for her business.

loans.name: Sorn

texts.en:
Sorn is a villager from the Kandal Stoeng district of Kandal Province. She is 59 years and a widowed mother of three children.

For the past 23 years Sorn has sold sweets and desserts as her main source of income and makes about ten dollars a day. She also grows rice on the side.

Sorn has been with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner, for a long time. The positive impact of her past loans has helped her to lift her living conditions to a higher level. Now she is applying for a new loan of 1,100 USD in order to buy a plot of farmland. She wants to grow more rice so that she can triple her crop yield and earn herself a better income and lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy a plot of farmland.

loans.name: Mas' Group

texts.en:
Mas, 62, is a local villager from Tboung Khmom district of Kampong Cham province. To cover her daily cost of living, she grows rice and cassava as her main sources of income and she can earn 30,500 KHR per day. Mas is a four-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) with a successful repayment of her past three loans, and they have helped her family to have sufficient food. 

Now, in a group of two, she is the leader. For this cycle, she and her co-borrower are requesting the loan amount of 1,400,000 KHR each. Mas will use her loan portion to pay for labor for her cassava business. She hopes her cassava will yield a better harvest so that she can get extra income for supporting the family.

loans.use: To pay for labor for her cassava business.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Purity

texts.en:
Purity is 47 years old and runs a food stall in Kangundo town. She sells potato fries (french fries) and she has been in this business for two years now. She is married and together with her spouse, who also provides additional income, has been blessed with six children.

She plans to use this loan to buy more stock of potatoes and cooking oil for use in her business. She will use the generated profits to repay the loan and also save some. 

This is Purity's first loan from VisionFund Kenya and her future hopes are to buy electrical cookers for use in her business as well as build a modern home.

loans.use: To buy more stock of potatoes and cooking oil.

loans.name: Sruoch

texts.en:
Sruoch is an experienced farmer from a rural village of Prey Chhor district in Kampong Cham province. He is married and has six children of various ages. His wife also works as a farmer and helps him with his daily farming chores. Aside from working on his own farm, Sruoch owns a tractor and provides tilling service to local farmers for additional income. From his current businesses, he is able to earn well for the family.

This will be his first loan, and Sruoch will use it to fix his tractor that is partly broken. Sruoch believes that through this loan, he will be able to continue working in his current business and augment his income for the family.

loans.use: to fix his tractor that is partly broken.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Zainab is 45 years old and married with five children. She runs a retail business in OIC, Makeni Northern area in Sierra Leone. She was a housewife but she started a business to empower herself.

She has been in this business since 1998 and sells Pure Water, drinks, cigarettes and biscuits within her community.  She says despite the challenges she desires to educate her children.

Zainab requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more Pure Water, drinks, cigarettes and biscuits to expand her business. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her to take care of her family's welfare and expand her business. In the future, she would like expand her business more than ever.

loans.use: to purchase more Pure Water, drinks, cigarettes and biscuits to expand her business.

loans.name: Emmy

texts.en:
Emmy is a 31-year-old married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 2 years to 6 years. She describes herself to be focused. 

She operates a tailoring business where she makes clothes. Her business is located in an accessible and secure place, and her primary customers are regular customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be high operational costs, including the cost of materials. 

She will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy fabric, thread and other tailoring materials. 

Her business goal is to expand within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be financially stable. 

This is her first loan with SMEP DTM. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread and other tailoring materials.

loans.name: Davido

texts.en: Davido works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business buying and selling rice in the Philippines. Davido requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell. She has been in this business for two years. Davido would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is a 32-year-old married man with one child living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. 

His business is selling clothes and textiles to supplement his income from farming, with its related risks and price fluctuations. He faces the challenges of customers who fail to pay on time and a seasonal demand for clothes. His aspiration is to own a wholesale and standard boutique. 

Alex is requesting for a loan to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence lives in Nanyuki in the central province in Kenya. She is 22 years old and she is married with one child. She runs a grocery store that has been in operation for the last two months. She learned about Milango through friends and now she seeks a loan to buy carrots, potatoes and cabbages for sale. 

Florence hopes that in the next five years her business will grow and she will raise money to buy a piece of land to settle on with her family. The challenge in her business is its seasonal nature. The extra income that she will earn will help her pay school fees for her child.

loans.use: to buy carrots, potatoes and cabbages

loans.name: Alban

texts.en:
Alban wants to buy potato seeds with this loan which will be his first one. “The season has already started to prepare for planting potatoes. In our village, well, in our entire region, the soil supports the potatoes' growth and we are lucky in that sense. This year, it also didn’t snow as it did other years and this is another plus for starting planting potatoes soon," Alban said.

Alban is in his early 40s and has two children; seventeen and fourteen, and for the past almost twenty years he has been doing agriculture. This has been their source of income in addition to his other profession, driving and repairing agricultural machines. He owns one of them.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds

loans.name: Milton Antony

texts.es:
Milton, un campesino de 25 años de edad, vive con su esposa y su hijo de 5 años. Nació en una familia humilde que encontró en el campo todos los recursos necesarios para el sustento, aprendió con su padre y sus hermanos mayores a trabajar la tierra y, gracias a ello, hoy en día posee cultivos de maíz, fríjol, tomate de árbol y arveja, cuyas cosechas recolecta y vende en la plaza de mercado del municipio donde reside; esto le ha permitido generar ingresos para llevar el sustento a su familia y solventar los gastos básicos.
Su empuje, dedicación y perseverancia lo impulsan a buscar alternativas para seguir avanzando, por ello encuentra en el crédito un apoyo, con el que desea comprar insumos agrícolas al por mayor (pesticidas, abonos, fungicidas, entre otros), esto le permitirá seguir cuidando sus cultivos para sacar una cosecha mucho más productiva, que le genere mejor rentabilidad a la hora de venderla en el mercado.
Milton se considera un hombre emprendedor y en un futuro cercano, se proyecta ampliando sus cultivos para garantizar a su familia una estabilidad económica favorable que le brinde la posibilidad de dar una buena educación a su hijo y una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Milton, 25, is a farmworker who lives with his wife and son, 5.  He was born into a humble family that found everything they needed to support themselves in the country.

Milton learned to work the land from his father and his older brothers, thanks to which he currently has corn, bean, tamarillo, and pea crops.  He harvests the crops to sell in the market plaza in the town where he lives.  This has allowed him to generate income to support his family and cover his basic expenses.

His drive, dedication, and perseverance lead him to look for alternatives to continue moving forward.  The loan will help him buy agricultural inputs wholesale (pesticide, soil amendments, fungicide, and other things).  This way he can continue taking care of his crops and get a better harvest that will be more profitable when it comes time to sell it in the market.

Milton considers himself to be an enterprising man.  He sees himself expanding his crops in the near future so he can guarantee his family good financial stability and give his son a good education and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy pesticide, soil amendments, fungicide, and other agricultural inputs

loans.name: Divina

texts.en: Divina is 40 years old, married, and has three children. Divina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and applied for a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell, including coffee, chips, bread and canned goods. Divina has borrowed and repaid 24 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from a restaurant. Divina aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like, including coffee, chips, bread and canned goods.

loans.name: Joelinda

texts.en: Joelinda is 45 years old, married, and has four children, one of whom is in school. She works very hard to provide for them. Joelinda runs a general store in the Philippines and applied for a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF to buy stocks of goods to sell, including canned goods, eggs, sugar, soap and milk. Joelinda has been in this business for five years. In the future, Joelinda would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy stocks of goods to sell, including canned goods, eggs, sugar, soap and milk.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en: As a married parent of six children, Lilian works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from food vending. Lilian is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her store, including canned goods, eggs, chips, milk and shampoo. Lilian has been sustaining her business activities with her past loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell, including canned goods, eggs, chips, milk and shampoo.

loans.name: Saream

texts.en: Saream, 50, is a local villager from the Phonhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province. She is a mother of one dependent son who is in school. To feed her family, she grows rubber trees as her main source of income, and does rice farming to earn additional income. She has been in this business for 18 years and it has helped her family. Now, she is seeking her first loan with Kiva partner VisionFund in the amount of 4,000,000 KHR to buy an additional plot of farmland so she can expand her agribusiness. She hopes to expand her farmland on a bigger scale so that she can triple her income.

loans.use: To buy an additional plot of farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Beatrice Group

texts.en:
Beatrice Group is comprised of four members who live in the same neighborhood and come together whenever they need to. 

Beatrice is the Group’s representative.  She is single and has no children. 

Beatrice sells wigs and hair products. She needs financial support to improve her business.  Beatrice has requested this loan in order to buy more wigs and hair products for resale to her customers.  She has eight years of experience in her business and works from 8:00 AM to 7:00 PM.  Beatrice would like to strengthen and diversify her business. 

In the future, she would like to use loans from this field partner to open a bigger shop in order to attract more customers and increase her earnings.

The Group members will need a total amount of 4,900 GHS in order to improve their businesses.

loans.use: to buy wigs and hair products for resale to her customers.

loans.name: David

texts.es:
David es estudiante del 3er año de Administración, vive con sus padres, y comenta que su meta es poder ayudarlos por medio de sus estudios.
Es una persona que se destaca por el esfuerzo y las ganas que tiene de poder salir adelante y ayudar a las personas que necesiten de sus servicios.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en pagar sus cuotas, y así estar cerca de cumplir su sueño de ser un profesional.
texts.en:
David is in his third year of studies in management.  He lives with his parents and says his goal is to be able to help them through his studies.

David is someone who stands out for his effort and his desire to be able to get ahead and help people who need his services.

He's requesting this loan to pay his fees and be closer to achieving his dream of being a professional.

loans.use: to pay his fees

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret lives in the Nanyuki area in the central province of Kenya. She is 41 years old, a wife and mother of three. She is a business lady and she runs a grocery store that has been in operation for the last one year. She learned about Milango through friends who asked her to join so that she could save and access funding for her small business. 

She now seeks a loan to buy carrots and potatoes for resale. She hopes that she will do business and raise funds to buy a piece of land for her family. The challenges that she faces in the business are competition and the seasonal nature of the market. The extra income that she will raise will improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy carrots and potatoes

loans.name: Sonia Patricia

texts.es:
Sonia reside en un pueblo del oriente antioqueño, allí ha pasado toda su vida y, hoy en día tiene su propio negocio, una charcutería en la que ofrece licor, cerveza, gaseosas, mecato, hace recargas y vende minutos a celular; además presta el servicio de alquiler de mesas de billar; la idea de negocio, surgió por la necesidad de generar recursos que le permitieran velar por el bienestar de sus 3 hijos y de solventar los gastos básicos del hogar; trabaja sola todos los días y ya lleva aproximadamente 7 años realizando esta labor.
Actualmente solicita el apoyo del crédito para comprar mercancía al por mayor (cervezas, gaseosas, licor, recargas, mecato, entre otros), lo que le permitirá satisfacer los requerimientos de su clientela y así mejorar los ingresos en esta temporada navideña.
Sonia, se siente afortunada de tener su negocio independiente, pero es ambiciosa y sueña con adquirir su casa propia, con la que podrá dar mejor bienestar y calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Sonia lives in a village in western Antioquia, and has lived there all her life. Today she has her own business: a deli where she sells liquor, beer, soft drinks, snacks, and mobile phone minutes and refills; she also rents out billiards tables. The idea for the business came about due to the need to provide for her 3 children and to pay for household expenses. She works alone every day and has been running this business for about 7 years. 

Currently, Sonia is requesting a loan in order to buy products wholesale (beer, soft drinks, liquor, phone refills, and snacks, among other items), which will allow her to meet customer needs and increase her income during the Christmas season.

Sonia is grateful to have an independent business, but is ambitious and dreams of having her own home to provide more comfort and a better quality of life to her children.

loans.use: to buy products wholesale (beers, soft drinks, mobile phone refills, and snacks, among other items).

loans.name: Sreyrot's Group

texts.en:
Sreyrot is a villager from Tboung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province.  She is 23 years old a young mother of one dependent daughter who is too young for schooling. 

To earn a living for the family, she and her husband work as rice farmers to provide the main source of income and buy recycle/disposal items for resale to provide supplemental income.  She has been with this business for five years and it has returned 27,200 KHR per day. 

Now, she leads the group of two borrowers.  Both of them are in their first loan cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner).  They are each requesting a loan in the amount of 1,000,000 KHR.  As the group leader, she will use her entire loan to pay for road preparation in her village.  She hopes that her village will have a good road to make travel easier and safer by creating a safety area.

loans.use: to pay for road preparation in her village.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Kynash

texts.ru: Кынаш 51 год, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. Старший сын проживает отдельно, второй сын находится на заработках в Казахстане, дочь-школьница. У Кынаш - средне-специальное образование, в данное в данное время работает сторожем в местной школе. По характеру Кынаш очень ответственная, общительная, жизнерадостная. Вместе с мужем Кынаш занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 20 лет назад, с покупки скота на 4,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Кынаш, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 2 теленка, а также обрабатывает 1,80 ГА земли, где в основном выращивает -фасоль и клевер. Полученный урожай реализуют оптовым поставщикам.Ежемесячный доход составляет 16,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Кынаш обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку бычков для увеличения поголовья скота. После закупки бычков, они будут находиться в собственном хозяйстве. Летом скот будет под присмотром пастуха. Доходы от кредита Кынаш планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на проведение свадебного торжества для сына.
texts.en:
Kynash is 51 years old and married. She and her spouse are raising 3 children. Their oldest son lives on his own, their second son is a migrant worker in Kazakhstan, and their daughter is in grade school.

Kynash has a vocational degree and currently works as a custodian at the local school. Kynash is a very responsible, friendly, life-loving person. She and her husband keep a farm with livestock and crops, which they started 20 years ago with a purchase of 4,000 som's worth of animals. Thanks to her hard work, today Kynash's farm has two dairy cows, two calves, and also 1.8 hectares of land on which they mostly grow beans and clover. The harvest is sold by wholesale vendors.  Their monthly income is 16,000 KGS.

With the goal of expanding her farm business, Kynash has applied to the microfinance bank "Bai Tushum and Partners" for a loan. The loan is for the purchase of bulls to increase their number of livestock. Once the bulls are purchased, they will be kept on their own farmland. In the summer they'll be cared for by a cowherd. Kynash plans to save the profit from the loan to accrue more farm animals, as well as to save for her son's wedding celebration.

loans.use: to buy bulls

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary does livestock farming in Kangundo town. She rears goats and later sells them at a profit. She has been in this business for two years. She is 28 years old, married, and together with her spouse she has been blessed with three children.

She plans to use this loan amount to buy goats for rearing and later sell them. She will use the anticipated profits to save for her children's education. 

This is her first loan from VisionFund Kenya and in future she hopes to be a successful businesswoman and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy goats.

loans.name: Vanna's Group

texts.en: Vanna, 38, is a local villager from the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She is married and blessed with seven children. Currently, only four kids still rely on her as they are in school. To support the family, she grows rice and plants pineapple as her main source of income. To earn additional income, she works as a paid worker. She has been in this business for twelve years and it has provided her with a decent income and sufficient food for her family. She has been with Kiva partner VisionFund for two loan cycles. Her most recent loan, which she has repaid, has improved her lifestyle. Now, she is the leader of a two-person group. Including this loan, she and her co-borrower are in their third cycle and are requesting a new loan of 1,400,000 KHR each.  As the group leader, Vanna will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer for her pineapple planting. She hopes her pineapples will produce a better yield than last year.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her pineapple planting

loans.name: Saffiatu

texts.en:
Meet 30-year-old Saffiatu from Masuba, located in the Makeni Southern area in Sierra Leone.  She is married and has two children.  

In 1996, Saffiatu established her assorted drinks business.  She began her business because she wanted to contribute while taking care of her children.  She works at the business 10 hours per day and six days per week.  She says that the main challenges she faces in her business are price inflation and insufficient capital to expand her business.

Saffiatu requires a loan in order to purchase more assorted drinks and pure water for resale.  She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her standard of living and also expand her business.  

In the future, Saffiatu plans to expand her business more than ever.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase assorted drinks and pure water for resale.

loans.name: Ma. Luz

texts.en:
