Ma. Luz is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy vegetables to sell for herl vegetables business.

Ma. Luz has been in this business for 32 years. Ma. Luz earns other from buying and selling charcoal.

Ma. Luz has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she could buy land in the future.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
As the married parent of four children, Grace works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, andshe also earns income from farming rice. 

Grace is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy items to sell, such as snack foods, sugar, soap, canned goods, shampoo, and other groceries for her general store business.

Grace has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of  saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: TO buy items to sell, such as snack foods, sugar, soap, canned goods, shampoo, and other groceries

loans.name: Ana Lucia

texts.es:
Ana tiene 31 años de edad de estado civil Unión Libre tiene dos hijos vive con el esposo y con los hijos en el Recinto Desvió De los Amarillo perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos. 

Pertenece a la Ventanilla PEQUEÑOS AGRICULTORES se encuentra ubicada el  recinto Desvió de los Amarillos, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias. 

Ana se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y la crianza de animales de corral como pollos y cerdos. Con el crédito podrá comprar insumos como: fertilizantes, abonos, semillas, urea, insecticidas para evitar las plagas y enfermedades, además alimento para los animales balanceados. Las compras las realiza en la ciudad de Ventanas. 

El sueño es comprar un terreno para seguir sembrando. Y festejar las fiestas por que le gusta bailar.
texts.en:
Ana is 31 years old, in a common-law relationship and has two children. She lives with her husband and children in the area of Desvió De los Amarillos, part of the Ventanas Canton in Los Ríos Province. Ana belongs to the PEQUEÑOS AGRICULTORES communal bank, located in the same area. The people here make a living through agriculture and livestock.

Ana earns a living by farming corn and raising corralled animals such as chickens and pigs. She will use the loan to buy supplies such as fertilizers, manure, seeds, urea, insecticides to prevent infestations and diseases, as well as animal feed. The purchases will be made in Ventanas city. 

Ana's dream is to buy her own land and continue planting, as well as to enjoy the holidays, as she likes to dance.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, manure, seeds, urea, and insecticides to avoid infestations and diseases, as well as animal feed.

loans.name: Ma. Elena

texts.en:
Ma. Elena is 41 years old and married, with four children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers, insecticides, pesticides, and other farm supplies.

Ma. Elena has been farming rice for four years, and she earns additional income from buying and selling vegetables.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, insecticide, pesticide, and other farm supplies

loans.name: Edda

texts.en:
As the married parent of one child, Edda works hard to support her family.

She has a  business buying and selling dried fish in the Philippines, and she also earns income from food vending.  

Edda is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional boxes of dried fish to sell for her dried fish business.

Edda has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Modesto

texts.es: Modesto: Es un señor amable, tiene 60 años de edad, originario de Puerto Cabezas, casado con 6 hijos: dos menores de edad, dos adolescentes que asisten al colegio y dos adultos, los cuales han formado su familia. Solicita financiamiento para mejorar las pequeñas viviendas de tambo y madera que alquila a precios accesibles, con el propósito de contar con una fuente de ingreso adicional, para apoyar a su familia, debido a que cuenta con un bajo salario en la institución que desde hace 20 años labora como abatizador  (aplica de químicos para evitar la plagas de mosquitos), por lo que desde hace 16 años tenía una cuartería, sin embargo, con el propósito de brindar una mejor servicio de alquiler construyo 2 viviendas de tambo y de madera, cada una cuenta con entrada independiente y letrina. Su sueño es construir 15 viviendas de minifalda de concreto y minifalda de madera.
texts.en:
Modesto, 60, is a friendly man from Puerto Cabezas.  He's married and has six children--two youngsters, two teenagers who attend school, and two adults who have their own families.

He's requesting financing to improve the small homes on stilts that he rents at affordable prices so he has an additional income to support his family.  He earns a low salary in the institution where he has worked for 20 years as an exterminator (applying chemicals to repel mosquitos).  For 16 years he has had a bunkhouse.  Nevertheless, with the goal of giving better rental services he built two houses on stilts, each one with its own entrance and latrine.

Modesto's dream is to build 15 homes with concrete skirting and wood skirting.

loans.use: to improve the small homes he rents out

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a 47-year-old married man with five children and lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda. 

He has been in commercial agriculture for four years. He obtains additional income from the cattle trade. 

Samuel is faced with a lack of capital to reinvest in and maintain his tea farm. He has a vision of planting more tea to increase his income.

He is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and manure for his tea farm.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and manure for his tea farm.

loans.name: Sabira

texts.ru: Сабире 53 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. Старшему сыну 22 года-студент, второй дочери 20 лет-замужем, младшему сыну 14 лет-школьник. У Сабиры - среднее образование, сразу же после окончания школы Сабира вышла замуж за Качкынбая. Сабира оптимистично идет по жизни, знает конкретно чего хочет и добивается всего своими силами, она знает как правильно использовать и планировать денежные средства для достижения поставленных целей. Сабира в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 23 года назад, с покупки скота на 4,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Сабиры, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 10 телят, 1 лошадь, 10 овец, а также обрабатывает 2,20 ГА поливной земли и 0,34 ГА огорода, где в основном выращивает -фасоль, клевер и клубнику. Полученный урожай реализуют оптовым поставщикам. Для содержания скота имеются все условия: сарай для содержания скота, отгонные пастбища. Сено и корма для скота заготовлены в достаточном количестве. Ежемесячный доход составляет 16,000 сом (KGS) от реализации молока, продажи фасоли и в летнее время от продажи клубники. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Сабира обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом -на покупку бычков для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Сабира планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на расширение помещения для скота.
texts.en: Sabira is 53 years old, married, and raising three children. The oldest son is a 22-year old student, the second oldest daughter is 20 years old and married, and the youngest son is a 14 year old schoolboy. Sabira has a secondary education. Sabira married Kachkynbay right after graduation. Sabira goes through life optimistically, knows exactly what she wants and achieves it on her own. She knows how to properly use and plan funds to achieve her goals. Sabira is the the main source of income for her family.  She raises crops and livestock, starting 23 years ago with the purchase of cattle for 4,000 KGS. Thanks to Sabira's hard work, she currently has 1 dairy cow, 10 calves, 1 horse, 10 sheep, and also farms 2.2 hectares of irrigated land and a 0.34 hectare backyard, where she mostly grows beans, clover and strawberries. She sells the crops wholesale. Sabira has all the necessary conditions to raise cattle: a barn and distant pastures.  She also has enough hay and fodder. She receives a monthly income of 16,000 som (KGS) from the sale of milk, beans, and, in the summer, strawberries. In order to further grow her household, Sabira has appealed to the Microfinance Bank "Bai - Tushum and Partners" for a loan for the purchase of steers for cattle breeding. Sabira plans to invest the loan income into further increasing the amount of livestock, and plans to save money to expand housing for the animals.

loans.use: to buy calves

loans.name: Soknoeun's Group

texts.en: Soknoeun is a 29-year-old resident of the Moung Russey district in Battambang province. She is also a young mother of four dependent children who are too young for schooling. To feed the family, she grows rice and pineapples as her main source of income; she also works as a paid worker for supplemental income. She has been doing this for around ten years and it has earned her about 40,000 KHR per day. Soknoeun has been with Kiva partner VisionFund for two loan cycles. Her past two loans, which she has successfully repaid, have helped her to improve her living conditions at a good pace. Now, she is leading a group of two to get a new loan from VisionFund. She is seeking 1,000,000 KHR, while her co-borrower is applying for 600,000 KHR. As the leader, Soknoeun will use her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer for her pineapple planting and to pay fees associated with her rice reaping. She hopes to gain a good income for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her pineapple planting and to pay fees associated with her rice reaping

loans.name: Almira

texts.en:
This is Almira in the backyard of her house, a 40-year-old mother of an 18-year-old who goes to school. She has been a good client of VFA for a very long time.

Her focus in the last fifteen years has been in agriculture; she grows and sells fresh produce in a city near their village. She wants to buy onion seeds with this loan. Here is what she said to the loan officer: “Many people in my village, especially men, have immigrated to Greece and that was a good boost to their families. However, no one in my family did that, so poverty has been inevitable. We do our very best at working hard, but that doesn’t mean that we will come out of poverty; we were destined to live in poverty.”

loans.use: to buy onion seeds

loans.name: Teley Group

texts.en:
The group is made up of three hardworking members. One member is Teley. She is 41 years old, married, and works selling fish and footwear. She has been selling her products in the Teshie area for eight years. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase a variety of footwear and fish to sell customers.

Simon sells drinks and cosmetics. Mary sells candy and perfumes.

They need a total amount of 3400 GHS during this cycle of loan requests.

loans.use: to purchase footwear and fish to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is an entrepreneur selling vegetables, fruit, and meat within her village. She is married and has four children. Two of them attend school and are in need of a daily allowance. Elizabeth is very patient and hopes for business improvement. She has determination to let her children finish their studies and have a comfortable lifestyle. She is asking for additional capital of PHP 7,000 to buy pork meat, cabbages, eggplant, and tomatoes. She knows that this loan amount will help increase her sales. She will pay back her loan in full and keep developing good sales for the welfare of her family.

loans.use: to buy pork meat, cabbages, eggplant, and tomatoes for her fruit and vegetable vending business.

loans.name: Milkah

texts.en:
Milkah is a married woman with two children. She describes herself to be honest. 

She operates a construction business where she builds roads. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a convenient place. 

Milkah describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. She will use the 50,000 KES loan to buy spare parts for her construction machinery. Her business goal is to be an international construction business within five years. 

This is her second loan with SMEP - Deposit Taking Microfinance Limited. Her previous loan of 20,000 KES was successfully repaid. 

Milkah will use the anticipated profits to take care of her family. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her construction machinery.

loans.name: Shazada

texts.en:
Shazada is 44 years old, married and the mother of four children. 

For 10 years, Shazada has been running a business selling milk with the support of her husband.  She has 2 buffalos.  She tends to the cattle while her husband sells milk door-to-door.  

While talking to the Kashf officer, she shared the feeling of achievement she got from sending her children to schools for a better education. She has some savings and applied for a loan of PKR 50,000 to purchase another buffalo. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

She is in her 5th loan cycle with Kashf Foundation with a good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Roselind

texts.en:
Roselind is a Kiva borrower who describes herself as honest. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes and has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a busy, central place and she doesn't have any specific clientele. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds to buy more stock. She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy additional stock of clothes. Her business goal is to expand within 5 years and she hopes that the future will be bright. She will use the anticipated profits to take care of her family.

This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy additional stock of clothes

loans.name: Maritza Marlene

texts.es:
Maritza tiene 31 años de edad de estado civil Unión Libre tiene cuatro hijos vive con el esposo y con los hijos en el Recinto Desvió De los Amarillo perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos. 

Pertenece a la Ventanilla PEQUEÑOS AGRICULTORES se encuentra ubicada el  recinto Desvió de los Amarillos, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias. 

Maritza se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y la crianza de animales de corral como pollos y cerdos. Con el crédito podrá comprar insumos como: fertilizantes,semillas, abonos, urea, además alimento para los animales balanceados engorde y crianza. 

Las compras las realiza en la ciudad de Ventanas. 

El sueño es comprar un terreno para seguir trabanjando para incrementar los ingresos familiares, le gusta mucho ser colaborador en las fiestas con el barrio.
texts.en:
Maritza is 31 years old, in a common-law marriage, and has four children. She lives with her husband and children in the community of Desvió de los Amarillo, part of the canton of Ventanas in the province of Los Ríos. She belongs to the Pequeños Agricultores ["Small Farmers"] communal bank,  located in the same community. The bank is dedicated to agriculture and livestock farming.

Maritza makes a living in agriculture, sowing corn and raising farm animals such as chickens and pigs. With this loan, she will be able to buy supplies such as fertilizer, seeds, manure, urea, insecticides to avoid infestation and disease, as well as feed for the animals being raised and fattened. She buys her supplies in the city of Ventanas. Her dream is to buy land in order to continue working and increase her income. Maritza loves to take part in neighborhood parties.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds, manure, urea, and animal feed for animals being raised and fattened.

loans.name: Ailyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Ailyn works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from motorcycle transport and raising pigs. Ailyn is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Ailyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 27 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita works hard to support her family. She is single and has a busines of fishing and selling fish in the Philippines.

Angelita requested a loan of 11,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy additional fishing netting and other fishing equipment. She  has been in this business for two years now.

In the future, Angelita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing netting and other fishing equipment.

loans.name: Elias Ivan

texts.es:
Elias tiene 32 años de edad de estado civil Unión Libre tiene dos hijos vive con la esposa y con los hijos en el Recinto Desvió De los Amarillo perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos. 

Pertenece a la Ventanilla PEQUEÑOS AGRICULTORES se encuentra ubicada el  recinto Desvió de los Amarillos, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias. 
 

Elias se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz y la crianza de animales de corral como pollos. Con el crédito podrá comprar insumos como: fertilizantes, abonos, semillas una bomba para fumigar y además alimento para los animales balanceados de engorde y crianza. 

Las compras las realiza en la ciudad de Ventanas. 

El sueño es seguir trabajando para tener mas ingresos para la familia, le gusta mucho trabajar y descarsar cuando hay tiempo libre.
texts.en:
Elias is 32 years old. He is in a common-law marriage and has two children. He lives with his wife and children in Recinto Desvio de los Amarillo, which belongs to the canton of Ventanas in Los Ríos Province. 

He belongs to the solidarity group Pequenos Agricultores, located in Recinto Desvio de los Amarillos, which belongs to the canton of Ventanas. He works farming and raising livestock.

As a farmer, Elias grows corn and rice and raises small animals like chickens. This loan will allow him to buy supplies like fertilizer, seeds, a fumigating pump, and also balanced feed to raise and fatten his animals. He makes his purchases in the city of Ventanas. 

His dream is to keep working in order to have more income for his family. He enjoys working and also resting when there is spare time.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds, a fumigating pump, and also balanced feed to raise and fatten his animals.

loans.name: Felix Albepto

texts.es:
Felix tiene 63 años de edad vive en Union Libre vive con la compañera y con cuatro hijos en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de Los Rios.

La ventanilla Pequeños Agricultores se encuentre ubicada en el recinto Desvio de los Amarillos perteneciente al Canton Ventanas esta ventanilla se dedica a labores Agricolas y Pecuarias en especial de a la si9ebra de maiz.

Felix se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maiz y arroz ademas a la crianza de pollos. El credito lo necesita para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos y balanceados para la engorde y crianza para los pollos.

Con la ayuda del credito a podido comprar las cosas necesarias para los cultivos y para los animales.

Las ventas las realiza en el mercado de ventanas. Enfrenta desafios como los recursos economicos para invertir en el negocio.

El sueño es mejorar los ingresos para tener dinero para la educacion de los hijos. En los tiempos libre le gusta descansar.
texts.en:
Felix is 63 years old and is in a common-law marriage. He lives with his partner and their four children in the city of Ventanas, in Los Rios Province.

The solidarity group Pequeños Agricultores is located in Recinto Desvio de los Amarillos, which belongs to the canton of Ventanas. The members of this solidarity group work farming, specially corn, and raising livestock.

As a farmer, Felix grows corn and rice and also raises chickens. He needs this loan in order to buy seeds, fertilizer, and balanced feed for raising and fattening chickens. His previous loan allowed him to buy what he needed for his crops and for the animals. He makes his sales in the market in Ventanas. The challenge he faces is finding financial resources to invest in his business.

His dream is to improve his income in order to have money for his children's education. In his spare time, he enjoys resting.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, and balanced feed for raising and fattening chickens.

loans.name: Chinara

texts.ru: Чынаре 27 лет, замужем, имеет 3 детей. Чынара имеет среднее образование, по характеру: спокойная, уравновешенная и трудолюбивая. Супруг помогает по бизнесу. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, уже 10 лет занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с 10,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Чынары в хозяйстве имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 1 лошадь и 10 овец. Супруг занимается перевозкой пассажиров на собственной автомашине. Ее деятельность приносит около 15,000 сом (KGS) в месяц, от продажи молока, молочной продукции, а также от доходов супруга, что служит основой для покрытия расходов на питание и бытовые нужды семьи. Доходы от хозяйства позволили Чынаре увеличить поголовье скота. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Чынара обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку овец. Доходы от кредита Чынара планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего хозяйства.
texts.en: Chinara is 27 years old, married and has 3 children. Chinara has a secondary education. Her personality is calm, well-balanced and hardworking. Her husband also helps with the business. Chinara, as the main income for her family, has engaged in raising livestock for 10 years. She started this business with 10,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Chinara's hard work, today, her farm has 2 dairy cows, 1 horse and 10 sheep. Her spouse works transporting passengers by private car. Her work brings about 15,000 som (KGS) per month from the sale of milk and dairy products, as well as income from her spouse which provides for the cost of food and household needs for the family. Chinara has used the income from farming to increase the amount of livestock. In order to further develop her income, she has appealed to the Microfinance Bank "Bai - Tushum and Partners" for a loan for the purchase of sheep. Chinara plans to invest the loan income in to further expanding her farm.

loans.use: to buy sheep

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Meet 46-year-old Sarah from Masuba, in the Makeni Northern area of Sierra Leone.  She is married with 5 children.  

In 1985, Sarah established her retail business.  She began her business because she wanted to create income to take care of her children's education.  She works 10 hours per day and six days per week and says that the main challenge to her business is during the rainy season when her purchasing power is very weak.

Sarah requires a loan in order to purchase more soft drinks, cigarettes, bread and pure water for resale.  She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her standard of living and increase her business. In the future, Sarah plans to expand her business more than ever.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks, cigarettes, bread and pure water for resale.

loans.name: Feride

texts.en: Ferida bought a cow with the previous loan. She wants to add another one in an attempt to expand her business and she needs your help again.

loans.use: add more cows to her existing herd.

loans.name: Zarina

texts.en:
Zarina is a 34-year-old married woman who has been selling milk for the past 10 years. She has two daughters who are school-aged. 

Zarina has five calves and two milk cows. She sells the milk to many of her neighbors and also sells butter that she makes from the milk. 

Her business is good enough to help her lead a decent life. She has improved her business to meet day-to-day expenses. Zarina is happily running her business due to the support she has received. 

Now, she is requesting a loan of 50,000 PKR to purchase one more cow and feed for the calves. She hopes to have an increase in milk production which ultimately helps to generate more income.  

She is very motivated to provide her children with a beautiful life with a good education, food, and clothing.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow and feed for the calves

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is a 39-year-old married woman. She has successfully built her small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. Previously, with the help of a Kiva loan, she purchased  things needed for her store. 

To make her store fully stocked she is requesting a sixth loan of Rs 50,000 which she will use to buy stock of rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates. This way she would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. 

She wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy stock of rice, sugar and flour.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca vive en la casa de su hijo como cuidadora con su hija en la zona Mariscal Sucre de la ciudad de El Alto, Francisca se dedica a la venta de comida wallake (sopa de cabeza de pescado muy agradable), en distintas ferias de su zona de la ciudad de el alto. El crédito requiere para poder refaccionar un para de habitaciones en la vivienda en la que habita y poder brindar a su familia un mejor lugar para poder vivir. Necesita comprar estuco,cemento, ladrillos.

El sueño de Francisca es contar con un domicilio en condiciones de buena habitabilidad para confort de su familia.
texts.en:
Francisca lives in her son's house as a caretaker to his daughter. They live in the Mariscal Sucre area of the city of El Alto. Francisca works selling wallake (a very pleasing fish-head soup) in the different markets in her area of the city of El Alto. She needs this loan in order to be able to repair a couple of rooms in the home where she lives so that she can give her family a better place to live. She needs to buy stucco, cement, and bricks.

Francisca's dream is to have housing that is in good living condition for her family to live comfortably.

loans.use: to buy stucco, cement, and bricks to repair two rooms in her son's home, which is where she lives.

loans.name: Fermin

texts.es:
Fermin y su esposa viven en casa propia con sus 3 hijos en la zona German Bush de la ciudad de El Alto, Fermin trabaja como maestro albañil en la ciudad de el alto. El crédito requiere para  refaccionar su vivienda, para compra de cemento y estuco. Asi poder brindar a sus hijos un mejor lugar para poder vivir.

El sueño de Fermin es poder brindar a sus hijos el sustento y educación suficiente para que puedan ejercer una profesión subsistir en un ambiente cada vez más competitivo y así mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Fermin and his wife live with their three children in their own house in the district of German Bush in the city of El Alto. Fermin works as a master bricklayer in the city of El Alto. 

He needs the loan to make repairs to his home, and to buy cement and plaster. This will allow him to provide his children with a better place to live. 

Fermin hopes to provide his children with support and enough education to allow them to have a career in an increasingly competitive environment, and thus improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy cement and plaster to repair a couple of rooms in his house and provide greater comfort to his children.

loans.name: Elena Antonia

texts.es:
Elena tiene 28 años de edad vive en Union Libre vive con el compañero y con cuatro hijos en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de Los Rios.

La ventanilla Pequeños Agricultores se encuentre ubicada en el recinto Desvio de los Amarillos perteneciente al Canton Ventanas esta ventanilla se dedica a labores Agricolas y Pecuarias en especial de a la si9ebra de maiz.

Elena se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maiz y arroz ademas a la crianza de pollos. El credito lo necesita para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos y balanceados para la engorde y crianza para los pollos.

Con la ayuda del credito a podido comprar las cosas necesarias para los cultivos y para los animales.

Las ventas las realiza en el mercado de ventanas. Enfrenta desafios como los recursos economicos para invertir en el negocio.

El sueño es tener dinero para poder compara una casa o construir en uno de los terrenos que le dio el padre. En los tiempos libre le gusta bailar.
texts.en:
Elena is 28 years old, in a common-law marriage, and has four children. She lives with her spouse and children in the city of Ventanas in the province of Los Rios. The "Pequeños Agricultores" communal bank is located in the community of Desvio de los Amarillos, in the Ventanas canton. This communal bank is dedicated to agriculture and livestock, and especially the cultivation of corn. 

Elena earns a living by growing corn and raising chickens. She needs the loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, manure, as well as feed for raising and fattening chickens. With the loan, she will be able to buy the items she needs for her crops and animals. She will make the purchases in the market in Ventanas. 

Elena faces challenges such as limited financial resources to invest in her business. Her dream is to have enough money to be able to buy a house, or to construct a house on some of the land given to her by her father. In her free time, Elena likes to dance.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, and manure, as well as animal feed for raising and fattening chickens.

loans.name: Indira

texts.ru: Индире 29 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. У Индиры - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Индира занимается животноводством, стартовав 8 лет назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Индиры, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, также имеет земельный надел мерою 1,50 ГА  на котором выращивает фасоль и картофель. Ежемесячный доход составляет 6,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Индира обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом- на покупку бычков для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Индира планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на покупку земельного участка.
texts.en: Indira is 29 and married with three children. She has a high school education and works in animal husbandry as the primary source of income for her family, a business she started eight years ago with the purchase of livestock for 10,000 KGS. Thanks to her hard work, Indira now has one milk cow as well as a 1.5 hectare parcel of agricultural land on which she grows beans and potatoes, with a monthly income of 6,000 KGS. With the goal of further developing her business, Indira has turned to microfinance bank Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan to purchase steers to increase her number of livestock. She plans to invest profits from the loan toward further augmentation of the size of her herd, and to save toward buying more land.

loans.use: to buy steers

loans.name: 3.10.607.08.thiệu Chính Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hồng operates a food stall/restaurant selling meat. She is requesting a loan to purchase cattle meat to resell.

Hồng is 40 years old and she is married with two children. She is the group leader of the 3.10.607.08.Thiệu Chính solidarity group, which consists of 3 members. Hồng  lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with two dependents.

In 2012, Hồng joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Hồng has been involved in her business for more than 10 years. The main harship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hồng hopes for her business to do well, for her children to do well in school, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase cattle meat to resell.

loans.name: 3.11.800.09.thiệu Ngọc Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Lien operates a food stall/restaurant selling fruit. She is requesting a loan to purchase fruit to resell.

Lien is 34 years old and she is married with 2 children.  She is the group leader of the 3.11.800.09.Thiệu Ngọc solidarity group, which consists of 9 members.  Lien lives with 2 dependents in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2010, Lien joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Lien has successfully repaid 4 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Lien has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.  The main hardship that Lien faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profits, Lien hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase fruit to resell.

loans.name: 3.11.801.02.thiệu Ngọc Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hiệp is operating a business of tailor-made and clothing repair services. She is requesting a loan to purchase machines to do those tailor-made and clothing repairing services.  

Hiệp has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.  The main hardship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital.

Hiệp is 42 years old, and she is married, with three children.   Hiệp supports three dependents with her business in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

She is the group leader of the 3.11.801.02.Thiệu Ngọc solidarity group, which consists of three members.  In 2010, Hiệp joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. She has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profit, Hiệp hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, for her children to do well in school, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase machines to do tailor-made and clothing repairing service.

loans.name: 3.10.610.09.thiệu Chính Group

texts.en:
Thanh is applying for a loan to purchase calves to raise and sell in the future. She works in agriculture, raising poultry and cattle.  Thanh is 46 years old and she is married with 2 children--one of them lives at home, and the other is grown.  She is the group leader of the 3.10.610.09.Thiệu Chính solidarity group, which consists of 9 members.  Thanh lives in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2010, Thanh joined the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business.  Thanh has successfully repaid 1 loan from the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.  The main hardship that Thanh faces in her business is the lack of capital.  In the future, Thanh hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, for her children to do well in school, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase calves to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: 3.11.802.11.thiệu Ngọc Group

texts.en:
Hoa is applying for a loan to purchase calves to raise and sell in the future.  She works in agriculture, raising poultry and cattle.  Hoa is 41 years old and she is married with 2 children.  She is the group leader of the 3.11.802.11.Thiệu Ngọc solidarity group, which consists of 3 members.  Hoa lives with 2 dependents in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2010, Hoa joined the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business.  Hoa has successfully repaid 1 loan from the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.  The main hardship that Hoa faces in her business is the lack of capital.  With her business profit, Hoa hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, for her children to do well in school, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase calves to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Bibinor

texts.ru: Бибинор является учительницей в местной школе. Ей 59 лет. Она живет в районе Рудаки с мужем, свёкорю, двумя сыновьями и дочерью. Ее сыновьям по 17 и 15 лет, а дочери 2 годика. Сыновья занимаются учебой в школе. Они учатся в той школе, где Бибинор преподает более 15 лет. Бибинор любит школу и своих учеников. Она старается преподавать так, чтобы им было интересно учиться. Муж Бибинор скотовод. Он на протяжении 29 лет занимается выращиванием крупнорогатого скота. Бибинор после работы и в выходные дни помогает мужу в его деле, так как основной доход семьи поступает за счет животноводства. Бибинор собирается помочь мужу в увеличении поголовья скота. Она запрашивает кредит, чтобы купить пару голов бычков с целью развития бизнеса.
texts.en: Bibinor is a teacher at a local school. She is 59 years old. She lives in the Rudaki district with her husband, father-in-law, two sons and a daughter. Her sons are 17 and 15 years old, and her daughter is 2 years old. Her sons attend school school. They go to the school where Bibinor has taught for more than 15 years. Bibinor loves the school and her students. She tries to teach so that they are interested in learning. Bibinor's husband is a herder. He has been raising cattle for 29 years. Bibinor helps her husband in his business after work and on weekends, as the main family income comes from livestock. Bibinor's husband is going to help to increase the number of livestock. She has requested a loan to buy two heads of cattle to develop the business.

loans.use: to purchase two heads of cattle to expand her business

loans.name: Sonia Yamileth

texts.es:
Sonia es una joven de 28 años de edad, quien estudio hasta sexto grado en la comunidad, es madre de dos niños aun pequeños no estudian, su esposo trabaja con ella en la agricultura, crianza de aves de corral y ganado en pequeña escala.
Se acompañó hace a ya más de 6 años y gracias al esfuerzo que ambos han puesto han construido su propia vivienda de adobe. 
Ella trabaja en la agricultura y la ganadería desde que se acompañó con su esposo, hoy en día tiene cuatro vacas las cuales cuida con su esposo en los potreros de su suegro, quien fue quienes los impulso para desarrollarse en la vida y así darle un mejor futuro a sus hijos.
El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar dos vacas valoradas en $500 cada una, las cuales las tiene tratadas en la comunidad  y con las cuales ella pretende incrementar su pequeño hato ganadero, para procesar la leche ya sea para vender o para la alimentación de sus hijos.
Desde pequeña se creció en el campo,  ayudándole a sus padres en los trabajos del hogar y de la agricultura.
Sueña con crecer a sus hijos y apoyarlos en la educación, pues ella dejo de estudiar muy joven y quiere que sus hijos se preparen profesionalmente.
También sueña con ponerle ladrillo a su vivienda, pues el piso es de tierra y también quiere repellar la casa con cemento y arena para darle más protección a la vivienda.
texts.en:
Sonia, age 28, is a young woman who studied through the sixth grade in her community.  She is the mother of two children who are not in school since they are still small.  Sonia and her husband work together as farmers, but the also raise poultry and livestock on a small scale.  They have been married for more than six years and, thanks to their efforts, they have been able to build their own home out of adobe.  

Sonia has been a farmer and livestock breeder since marrying her husband.  At the moment, she and her husband are taking care of four cows that are kept in a pasture owned by her father-in-law, who encouraged them to develop in life so that they can provide a better future for their children.  The loan she is requesting will be used to buy two cows valued at $500 each, for which she has made agreements in her community.  The cows will be used to increase her small herd so that she can process milk to sell and also to feed to her children.  

Sonia grew up in the country when she was a young girl, helping her parents with the household chores and the farming.  She dreams of watching her children grow and helping them with their education since she had to quit school at a young age.  Sonia wants her children to become prepared professionally.  She also dreams of adding brick to her home since the floors are made of dirt.  In addition, she wants to whitewash her house with cement and sand so that her house will have an added layer of protection.

loans.use: to buy two cows.

loans.name: Alvaro

texts.es:
El es Álvaro, desde muy pequeño se quedo sin padres, el hermano menor y el quedaron al cuidado de la abuela, pero ella no los pudo mantener más, por esta razón se fueron protegidos por el Instituto Colombiano de Bienestar Familiar teniendo en cuenta que presento un diagnóstico de retardo mental limítrofe. Actualmente vive en una institución encargada de la atención de jóvenes como el.

Disfruta mucho de la cocina, por esta razón desea ampliar los conocimientos y lograr a futuro una vida independiente junto con al hermano, la ayuda que kiva le pueda brindar a alvaro sera indispensable para que el pueda ser una persona independiente con su hermano y tener un futuro un poco mejor para los dos.
texts.en:
This is Álvaro. He was orphaned at a very young age, so he and his younger brother grew up with their grandmother. But when she was unable to keep them, they were taken in by the Colombian Institute of Family Well-being. Álvaro has a diagnosis of borderline mental retardation. Currently, he lives in an institution that takes care of young people like him.

Álvaro really enjoys cooking. For this reason, he wishes to expand his knowledge and achieve a future independent life along with his brother. This support that Kiva offers him will be essential for him to become independent with his brother as well as to have a better future for the both of them.

loans.use: to pay one semester's registration fees.

loans.name: Musarat

texts.en:
Musarat is a 46-year-old married lady who has been running a small general store in her community for many years. She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. She makes enough to provide for her family. 

To make her store fully stocked she requested a loan for 60,000 Pakistan Rupees (PKR) which she will use to buy a stock of rice, sugar, and flour from the market at lower rates. In this way she would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy a stock of rice, sugar, and flour from the market at lower rates.

loans.name: Los Progresistas De Cupiche Group

texts.es:
The group "Los Progresistas De Cupiche" consists of diligent members who want to attain a good quality of life for their families.

Junior is 31 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has two dependent children. He raises pigs and chickens that he eventually sells to markets and restaurants. Junior has also been providing construction services for the past two years. A few years ago, he worked as a taxi driver.

His loan will be invested in the purchase of food for his animals. The group appreciates the Kiva lenders for providing this loan. Junior is the first person standing on the right side.

loans.use: to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Holanda Nola

texts.es:
Holanda is 38 years old and in a common-law relationship. She lives with her husband and children (ages 22 and 4) in the canton of Mocache in Los Ríos Province.

The Communal Bank named "Juntos Triunfaremos" (We Triumph Together) is located in the neighborhood of Jhon F. Kennedy 2, which is in the canton of Mocache near Ventanas. The members are farm laborers and livestock breeders.

Holanda is a farmer who has been growing corn and rice for a few years. She buys her products in Ventanas at the López commercial district and also sells at a market in the same area.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy compost and fertilizers for her corn and rice crops. As a result, the loan will help stimulate her family's finances. Her dream is to buy a plot of land.

Holanda enjoys traveling with her family.

loans.use: to buy compost and fertilizers.

loans.name: Martha Fabiola

texts.es:
Martha es una mujer e de 59 años, casada, gracias al esfuerzo de sus padres logró terminar la escuela primaria y luego  la falta de recursos económicos lo llevó a trabajar desde muy chica para poder sustentar sus necesidades. A pesar de tener un trabajo que le demanda mucho tiempo y esfuerzo, ella no se negó a educar y mantener a sus  hijas que en la actualidad tienen 35 y 37 años de edad. Ahora Martha vive con su esposo en la ciudad de Latacunga ubicado en la Provincia de Cotopaxi en la República del Ecuador ubicado en el centro de la ciudad, la casa donde viven es herencia de la suegra viven ahí ya muchos años. 
Martha en vista de la falta de recursos económicos en su hogar decidió dedicarse a vender joyas de plata y además es muy hábil para elaborar joyas en fantasías, esto ha servido para ayudar en su hogar, su esposo es jubilado y lo poco que gana no les alcanza para subsistir, hoy está solicitando un crédito para invertir en la construcción de un baño en su casa.
Además a Martha  le gustaría en el futuro tener su negocio  en un local propio y así llegar a más clientes que demandan el producto.  Martha agradece a Fundación Alternativa en Ecuador y a Kiva por hacer posible el crecimiento en su vida laboral y personal.
texts.en:
Martha is a married woman of 59 years of age. Thanks to the sacrifice of her parents, she was able to finish elementary school before the lack of financial resources brought her to work to be able to provide the necessities of life. Despite having a job that demanded much of her time and strength, Martha did not neglect to educate and support her daughters, who are now 35 and 37 years old. Now, Martha lives with her husband in the city of Latacunga, located in the province of Cotopaxi in the Republic of Ecuador. In the center of the city, they live in a house they inherited from Martha's mother-in-law. They have been there for many years now. 

Martha, in light of a lack of financial resources in her home, decided to make a living selling silver jewelry. She also is very skilled at making costume jewelry. This has served her to help maintain her house since her husband is retired and the little income he gets cannot sustain them. Today, Martha is requesting a loan to invest in the construction of a bathroom in her house. Furthermore, in the future, Martha would like to run her business from her own shop so that she can reach more clients who want her products. Martha is grateful to Fundación Alternativa in Ecuador and to Kiva for making possible this growth in her work and personal life.

loans.use: to invest in the construction of a bathroom in her house.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.es:
Jaqueline es separada  tiene dos hijos, uno en etapa escolar y el otro todavía no, viven en casa en de sus padres, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Villa Litoral de la ciudad de El Alto
Ella estudio hasta el nivel secundario, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa para niños; en esta temporada ella rota de mercaderia y ofre juguetes a sus clientes. Tiene un puesto de venta en la Ceja de el alto dicho puesto es de un familiar pero no paga alquileres.
El crédito lo requiere para  la compra juguetes de novedad : helicopteros a control remoto, barbies, casas de muñecas y otros para aprovechar la temporada y mejorar sus ingresos.
El sueño de Jaquelin es tener su propia jugueteria y ser distribuidora de ropa de niños.
Es la quintq vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la segunda  vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Jacqueline is separated. She has two children; one who is school-aged, and one who is still too young for school. They all live in her parents' home, which is located in the Villa Litoral area in the city of El Alto. 

Jacqueline studied up to the secondary level. She earns a living by selling children's clothing. In this season, she rotates her merchandise, and offers toys to her customers. She has a stall in the commercial area of El Alto. The stall belongs to a relative, but she doesn't pay to rent it. 

She needs the loan to purchase Christmas toys: remote control helicopters, Barbies, dollhouses, and others. She wants to take advantage of the season and increase her earnings. Jacqueline's dream is to have her own toy shop and be a distributor of children's clothing.  This is her fifth time requesting a loan through IMPRO, and the second time through KIVA.

loans.use: to buy toys to sell this Christmas.

loans.name: Ilhomiddin

texts.ru: Илхомиддин 23-летний студент. Он живет вместе с матерью в городке Вахдат, расположенный недалеко от столицы. Илхомиддин в данный момент холост. Он учится и параллельно работает. Илхомиддин учится на программиста в заочном отделении Технического Университета Таджикистана. Параллельно в течение года он работает оператором базы данных в микрокредитной депозитной организации. В этом году он еще не оплатил за учебу в университете. Ему срочно необходимо произвести оплату, однако у него на руках нет достаточной суммы. Илхомиддин решил получить кредит на образование, который предоставляет МДО "Хумо" на выгодных условиях. Илхомиддин просит финансовой поддержки, чтобы успешно окончить ВУЗ и получить диплом о высшем образовании. Он обещает выплачивать кредит в срок за счет своей работы.
texts.en: Ilhomiddin is a 23 -year-old student. He lives with his mother in the town of Vahdat, located near the capital. Ilhomiddin is currently single. He studies and works simultaneously. Ilhomiddin is studying programming at the correspondence department of the Technical University of Tajikistan. At the same time, over the past year, he has worked as a database operator at a microcredit deposit organization. This year, he has not yet paid his university tuition. He urgently needs to pay, but does not have enough money on hand. Ilhomiddin has decided to get a student loan, provided by the MDO " Humo " on favorable terms. Ilhomiddin requests financial support to successfully complete school and get a graduate degree. He promises to repay the loan on time due to his work.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es: El grupo “RENACER” está conformada por 10 mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras. Margarita tiene 55 años es separada con 02 hijos independientes. Hace 20 años viene trabajando en su librería bazar. Y a la vez es profesora de manualidades. Años atrás trabajaba como docente. El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de útiles escolares cuadernos lapiceros fólderes. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo brindado. Margarita es l asegunda persona sentado del lado izquierdo viste polo blanco y chaleco rojo.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Renacer" is made up of 10 enterprising and hardworking women.  Margarita, 55, is separated and has 2 grown children.  For 20 years, she has been working in her stationery store.  In addition she teaches handicrafts.  Some years ago, she used to work as a teacher.  

Margarita will invest this loan in schools supplies, including notebooks, pens, and folders.  This group thanks the Kiva lenders for the loan that they are providing.  Margarita is the second person from the left, wearing the white shirt and the red vest.

loans.use: to buy notebooks, folders and pens

loans.name: Mokhira

texts.ru: Мохире 42 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 2 детей. Старшая дочь-замужем, сын -школьник. У Мохиры - среднее образование. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Мохира занимается полеводством, стартовав 15 лет назад, с 10,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Мохиры, на сегодняшний день имеется: 0,27 ГА земельной доли, на которой ежегодно выращивает ранние сорта картофеля и капусты для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. Мохира имеет очень хороший опыт в выращивании ранних сортов картофеля и капусты. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Мохира обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку семян картофеля, семян капусты, минеральных удобрений и ядохимикатов для обработки земли. Доходы от кредита помогут Мохире улучшить финансовое состояние семьи.
texts.en: Mokhira is 42 years old, married, and raising two children. The older daughter is married, the son is a student. Mokhira has a secondary education. As the main income for her family, Mokhira raises crops.  She started 15 years ago, with 10,000 KGS. Thanks to Mokhira's hard work, today she has a 0.27 hectare plot of land, which annually grows early varieties of potatoes and cabbage farm for consumption and sale. Mokhira has very good experience in growing early varieties of potatoes and cabbage. She receives a monthly income of 10,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her farm, she has appealed to Microfinance Bank "Bai - Tushum and Partners" for a loan for the purchase of potato and cabbage seeds, fertilizer and pesticides for farming. Mokhira plans to use the loan income to help her family financially.

loans.use: to buy potato and cabbage seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides

loans.name: Las Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo Las Emprendedoras inician el 1º ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas tienen ansias de poder seguir creciendo y mejorando sus vidas.
 Dentro del comité se destacan  varias personas pero en particular la Sra. Sandra quien es comerciante y también es  limpiadora en una Escuela cercana a su casa. Ella se esfuerza día a día para poder mejorar, lo cual está logrando por medio de las capacitaciones que está recibiendo de la fundación paraguaya.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de artículos varios para la venta, como ser bebidas, aceite, jabones, yerba y demás, y así seguir trabajando y luchando por el sustento de su familia.
texts.en:
The “Las Emprendedoras” group is beginning its first cycle of the committee for women program, where they are all anxious to continue growing and improving their lives.

There are various persons in the group worth mentioning and Sandra is one of them.  She is a merchant and cleaning woman at a school near her home.  She works hard every day so she can improve her training from Fundacion Paraguaya.  She is asking for this loan to buy various articles to sell, such as beverages, cooking oil, soaps, herbs, and other things so she can continue working to support her family.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Mullojon

texts.ru: Муллочон житель города Вахдат. Ему 33 года. Он заботливый муж и отец. Муллочон в данный момент начинает прибыльный бизнес. Его давно интересовало животноводство. Теперь он решил действовать по намеченной цели. Муллочон при дворе дома создал коровник, запасся кормом для скота, а также накопил сбережение в размере 400 долларов. Однако этой суммы не достаточно, чтобы начать данный бизнес. Поэтому Муллочон обратился за кредитом. Он планирует купить четырех голов бычков, откармливать их в течение одного месяца и продавать с наценкой на скотном рынке. Благодаря кредиту у него будет работа, приносящая хорошую прибыль.
texts.en: Mullojon lives in the city of Vahdat.  He is 33 years old and he is a caring husband and father.  Mullojon is currently starting a new business.  He has been interested in raising animals for some time now, and he has decided to start working toward this goal.  He has built a barn next to his home, he has stocked feed for the animals and he also has saved up $400, but this sum is not enough to start his new business.  This is why Mullojon has asked for a loan.  He plans to buy four bulls, fatten them up for a month and then sell them on at for a profit at the animal market.  He will have work and a good income thanks to this loan.

loans.use: to buy four bulls to start his new livestock business

loans.name: 3.04.803.14.thiệu Phúc Group

texts.en:
Nguyệt works in agriculture, raising poultry and cattle.  She is requesting a loan to purchase calves to raise and sell in the future.  Nguyệt is 52 years old and she is married with 3 children.  Nguyệt is the group leader of the 3.04.803.14.Thiệu Phúc solidarity group, which consists of 4 members.  She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.  She has no dependents because her children are grown up.

In 2010, Nguyệt joined the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business.  Nguyệt has successfully repaid 1 loan from the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.  One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.  With her business profit, Nguyệt hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, for her children to do well in school, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase calves to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: 3.03.804.04.thiệu Lý Group

texts.en:
Oanh operates a food stall/restaurant selling meat.  She is requesting a loan to purchase pork pies and fermented pork rolls to resell.  She is 24 years old and she is married with one child.  Oanh is the group leader of the 3.03.804.14.Thiệu Lý solidarity group, which consists of 5 members.  She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2011, Oanh joined the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid 2 loans from the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Oanh has been involved in this business for 3 years.  One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.  With her business profit, Oanh hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, to build a new house, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase pork pies and fermented pork rolls to resell.

loans.name: 08-03-05-Phú Sơn 2 Group

texts.en:
Tuyết has a manufacturing business making incense.  She is requesting a loan to purchase materials to make incense to resell.  Tuyết is 42 years old and she is married with 2 children--one of them lives at home, and the other is grown up.  She is the group leader of the 08-03-05-Phú Sơn 2 solidarity group, which consists of 6 members.  She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Tuyết's first loan with the Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.  She has been involved in this business for 5 years.  The main hardship that Tuyết faces in her business is the lack of capital.  With her business profit, Tuyết hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase material to make incense to resell .

loans.name: Simona

texts.es: Doña Simona con su primer financiamiento pudo darle mantenimiento y asistencia a sus cultivos de hortalizas gracias al apoyo y confianza que los inversionistas en KIVA en alianza con la cooperativa COMIXMUL con las ganancias obtenidas dio la oportunidad a su hija a cursar el bachillerato por madurez el cual es cursado en menos de un año quien en enero comenzara su práctica profesional. Además gracias a otra parte de sus cultivos ella pudo llevar a cabo otros proyectos de cultivos como frijoles, maíz que es básico para la alimentación diaria. Por la buena administración que ella dio un buen uso a las ganancias destinando también parte de ellas a la compra de semilla certificada de papa de primera calidad para poder cultivar. Por lo que ella nuevamente está solicitando un segundo financiamiento esperando ser apoyada por los inversionistas en KIVA con el cual podrá preparar un pedazo de tierra que no está dando producción para cultivar el nuevo producto comprado y así poder seguir ampliando sus cultivos de hortalizas.
texts.en:
With her first financing, Simona was able to maintain and tend to her vegetable crops thanks to the support and trust that Kiva lenders in partnership with COMIXMUL co-op gave her. The profit she made allowed her to give her daughter the opportunity to finish high school for adults, which is done over a course lasting under one year. In January she will start a professional internship. Also, thanks to another part of the profit from her harvest she was able to carry out other projects and start growing beans and rice, which are staples of daily nutrition. 

Her good management allowed her to make good use of all her profits. She set aside part of it to purchase certified quality potato seed to plant. That is why she is again requesting a second loan in hopes of receiving Kiva lenders' support. This loan will allow her to prepare a plot of land that is currently not producing anything to plant the new product she bought in order to keep expanding her vegetable crops.

loans.use: to prepare her land for planting quality potato seed.

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es:
Alberto tiene 23 años está casado con Esther y tiene 1 hijo de tres años, con quien vive en su casa construida a base de adobe. Alberto se dedica a la producción y mantenimiento de plantaciones agrícolas tales como el cacao orgánico, palillo y café. Desempeña esta humilde y abnegada labor haces mas de 5 años junto a su esposa. Posee un terreno de 2 hectáreas que adquirió poco después de que su hijo naciera porque consideró necesario contar con una labor más estable y brindarle a su familia una buena calidad de vida.
Comenta que al iniciarse como agricultor independiente una de sus principales dificultades fue que no contaba con dinero suficiente para llevar a cabo la campaña productiva pero despues de un tiempo logro juntar el dinero suficiente. Actualmente ha logrado incrementar sus plantaciones de cacao debido al buen precio que ofrecen los compradores y espera a futuro ampliar el área de sus cultivos con la compra de terrenos colindantes. 
En esta oportunidad desea contar con 3,000 nuevos para invertirlos en la cosecha de sus productos como la contrata de trabajadores y pago de transporte hasta la ciudad.
texts.en:
Alberto, 23, is married to Esther, and they have a 3 year-old child that they live with in their home, which is made of adobe.  Alberto works as a farmer, producing and maintaining his crops of organic cocoa, turmeric, and coffee.  He's been doing this humble and self-sacrificing work for more than 5 years alongside his wife.  He has 2 hectares of land that he acquired soon after his son was born, because he felt he needed to have a more stable source of work so that he could provide a good quality of life to his family.

Alberto comments that when he was starting out as an independent farmer, one of the main problems he faced was not having enough money to carry out his work, but after some time he managed to save enough money.  Now he has managed to increase his cocoa plantings, due to the good price that he offers his buyers.  He hopes that in the future he can expand his plantations by purchasing adjacent fields.  

At this time, Alberto wants to borrow 3,000 Peruvian soles to invest in harvesting his products; he will use the money to hire workers and to pay to transport his harvest to the city.

loans.use: to hire workers and to transport his harvest

loans.name: Mujeres De Hernandarias Group

texts.es:
Mujeres de Hernandarias  está en su segundo  ciclo  del programa de comité, ellas también forman parte del programa de eliminación de pobreza, como un medio de poder conocer la situación de cada una de ellas y conforme a eso poder trabajar para ayudar a sus familias.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Marcia, quien en su  encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, es decir con ingresos muy bajos. Ella a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y  por medio de la venta de comidas que hace, está luchando por dar a su familia lo que necesitan para que no les falte nada.
Pide de este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para poder seguir haciendo sus comidas, como ser verduras, hortalizas, harina, huevo y demás. Agradecen la oportunidad que están recibiendo de poder seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres de Hernandarias” group is in its second cycle of the committee and they are part of the elimination of poverty program in order to know one another’s situation so they can work to help their families.

Marcia is one of the members whose survey showed a level one on the poverty scale, that is of very low income.  She, through her work and food sales, is working to provide her family with what they need.

She is asking for this loan to buy ingredients such as vegetables, flour, eggs, and other things so she can continue selling her food.  She is grateful for the opportunity she is getting to help get ahead.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es:
El grupo Renacer  está en su primer ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas se comprometieron a trabajar y a ayudarse entre todas para salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde dos de las diecisiete señoras se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir con ingresos bajos, pero ellas están trabajando por mejorar.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Feliciana, quien se dedica a la venta de comidas variadas que ella misma hace, y con lo cual lucha por poder dar a su familia todo lo que necesitan para el día a día. Es una persona que lucha y se esfuerza por poder dar lo mejor a su familia.
Pide de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para sus comidas, como ser verduras, carnes, pollo, queso, etc.
texts.en:
The “Renacer” group is in its first cycle in the committee for woman program where they all promise to work and help one another get ahead.  They are participating in the elimination of poverty program, where two of the 17women are below the poverty line.  In other words with low income, but they are working to improve.

Feliciana is one of the members who sells food that she cooks herself and is working to provide her family with everything they need each day.  She is a person who works hard and makes an effort to provide the best for her family.

She is asking for this loan so she can buy ingredients for her food, such as vegetables, meats, chicken, cheese, etc.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Antonia Elizabeth

texts.es:
Antonia tiene 33 años de edad vive en Union Libre vive con el compañero y con cinco hijos en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de Los Rios.

La ventanilla Pequeños Agricultores se encuentre ubicada en el recinto Desvio de los Amarillos perteneciente al Canton Ventanas esta ventanilla se dedica a labores Agricolas y Pecuarias en especial de a la si9ebra de maiz.

Antonia se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maiz y arroz ademas a la crianza de pollos y cerdos. El credito lo necesita para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos y balanceados para la engorde y crianza de los animales de coral.

Con la ayuda del credito a podido comprar las cosas necesarias para los cultivos y para los animales.

Las ventas las realiza en el ercado de ventanas.

El sueño es mejorar las ventas para tener mas ingresos en la familia. En los tiempos libres le gusta cocinar para toda la familia.
texts.en: Antonia is 33 years old and is in a civil union. She and her partner have 5 children. They live  in the city of Ventanas, in the province of Los Rios. The Pequeños Agricultores [Small Farmers] service point is located on the premises of Desvio de los Amarillos, owned by Canton Ventanas. This service point is dedicated to farming and fishing activities, especially growing corn. Antonia makes a living through farming and growing corn and rice in addition to raising chickens and pigs. She needs this loan in order to buy seeds, fertilizers, compost and supplements for fattening and breeding the animals that live in pens. With the help of this loan, she has been able buy the necessary things for farming and for the animals. Sales are made in the Ventanas enclosure. Her dream is to improve sales in order to have more income for her family. In her spare time she likes to cook for the whole family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, compost and supplements for fattening and breeding the animals that live in pens.

loans.name: Ashuroy

texts.ru: Ашурой деятельная и умелая женщина, проживает в районе Дж.Руми. Ей 42 года. Она замужем, имеет 21-летнего сына и 19-летнюю дочь. Ашурой умеет шить женские национальные платья. Она хочет использовать свое умение и открыть собственное швейное дело. Ашурой просит кредит для купли вышивальной машинки. Она планирует заняться этим делом дома. Ей будет помогать дочь. Они будут шить платья по заказу и их первыми клиентками будут знакомые, родственники и соседи.
texts.en: Ashuroy is an enterprising and capable woman who lives in the Jalal Rumi region.  She is 42 years old and she is married with a 21-year-old son and a 19-year-old daughter.  Ashuroy knows how to sew women's national dresses and she wants to use her talent to open her own sewing business.  She is asking for a loan to buy an embroidery machine.  She plans to do her sewing at home and her daughter will help her.  They will sew dresses to order and their first clients will be their acquaintances, relatives and neighbors.

loans.use: to buy an embroidery machine

loans.name: Women Of Grace Kihumbuini Group

texts.en:
Grace, Lilian, and Esther are neighbors. They come from the county of Murang’a in central Kenya. Being members of one of the groups benefiting from credit offered by VEP, the women have previously received water tank loans, a Mifugo (livestock) loan, and a school-fees loan, among others. This time they approached VEP for bio-gas credit that could enable them to construct bio-digesters to provide them with fuel for cooking and lighting.

Grace, standing on the right with a beaded necklace, has been a farmer for over ten years. However, she had no knowledge of the benefits she could reap from the animal waste/manure her farming produced, and has all along struggled with kerosene, charcoal, and wood. She only learned about bio-gas a year ago through a training conducted by VEP in their group, and she decided to take up the project once she completed repaying her earlier loans. Her wish is to have a smoke-free kitchen, cleaner cooking pots free from soot, and no stress from collecting wood or buying charcoal and kerosene. She says with the bio-gas, her husband will not mind warming his own meal when she is not around, unlike previously when he would stay hungry until she returned from work.

The women will also be trained on how to practice organic farming, hence improving and increasing their crop yields as a way of ensuring food security. Money saved from the purchase of charcoal and kerosene will be added to that earned from the sale of milk to enable their repayment of the loan.

loans.use: construct a bio-digester.

loans.name: Sadia

texts.en: Sadia is a 34-year-old married woman who has run a business selling milk with her husband for many years. She has one buffalo and sells its milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter that she makes from the milk. She looks after the buffalo and performs the task of collecting milk from it while her husband sells it to different places on daily basis. She needs to earn much more to meet their everyday expenses, including food and clothing. In order to make huge profits, she requested a loan of 40,000 Pakistan rupees to buy one more buffalo. This will help her to increase her sales and profits. She is in her sixth loan cycle with good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo.

loans.name: Suyani

texts.en:
Suyani lives in Bandung, the main city of West Java, located about two hours from Jakarta. She manages a small shop selling mobile phone airtime credits. Suyani is married and lives with four persons in the family home. Suyani joined Ruma because she was interested in selling mobile phone airtime and wanted to sell new products. With assistance and support from Ruma's staff, Suyani sees improvements in her shop. For the last three months, she earned an average of $52-53 in sales per day in mobile phone airtime credit sales (an increase of about 25% from her previous loan). Now, she hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital to process more transactions. 

She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone credit sales transactions

loans.name: Saffia

texts.en: Saffia is a 52-year-old married woman who has been in the business of selling milk for many years with the support of her husband (also shown in the photo). She has two cows. She sells their milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter that she makes from the milk. Her business is good enough to provide her a decent life. She also sells animals on a seasonal basis to generate extra income. She is the mother of five children and is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food, and clothing.  She has improved her business to meet the day-to-day expenses of life. It’s her seventh year with the Kashf Foundation; she is happily running her business through its support. She has now requested a loan of 50,000 Pakistan rupees to purchase one more cow. She hopes to increase the milk production capacity, which ultimately helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en: Shazia is 27 years old and a married woman. The man shown in the photo is Shazia’s husband, who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep up its functional routine. For this reason, Shazia has applied for a loan of 40,000 Pakistani rupees for her husband's business. He wants to buy new tires for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. Shazia is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires for her husband's vehicle.

loans.name: Tasneem

texts.en: Tasneem is a 41-year-old vigorous lady who has been doing boutique work for many years. She stitches clothes for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family.  By now, she has retained a good number of customers. To meet the demands of her customers, she requested a loan of Rs 40,000 from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to purchase bundles of cloth along with spools of threads, laces and zippers. It will allow her to stitch more dresses on time to generate a healthier source of income. She is in her third loan cycle with good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to purchase cloth, threads, laces and zippers.

loans.name: Shameem

texts.en:
Shameem is a 48-year-old married woman and the mother of three children. She is been working doing hand embroidery for many years. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home. 

To help her continue her operations, she has requested a loan of Rs. 40,000 to buy reels of threads in different colors and packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment. With these materials, she will be able to cater more customers consistently. She is hopeful to increase her income by targeting more customers. She is in her 4th loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to buy reels of threads in different colors and packs of beads, sequins and stones.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is a 34-year-old married man. He has two children who are two and eight years old. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a retail business where he sells cereals such as maize, beans, millet, and rice. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in an urban area and his primary customers are his regular customers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the poor road network. He will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals. His business goal is to be the best within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will expand his business. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. His previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to buy a dairy cow.

loans.use: to buy more cereals to sell

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 30 years old and lives in the Nanyuki area of central province Kenya. He is married with two children, and a business man who owns a small bakery. He heard about Milango through friends and decided to join so that he could access funding for his business. He now seeks a loan to purchase five bundles of flour. 

He is also a farmer and does poultry keeping for extra income. He hopes that in the next five years he will have expanded the bakery. The challenge that he faces is the price of commodities. The extra income that he will raise from the business will improve the business and he will also take his children to school.

loans.use: to purchase five bundles of flour.

loans.name: Kalsoom

texts.en:
Kalsoom is a 35-year-old married lady. She has been running a small general store in her community for many years. She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. She makes enough to provide for her family. 

To make her store fully stocked, she requested a loan for Rs 40,000, which she will use to buy rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates. 

In this way, she would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar and flour.

loans.name: Adama

texts.en:
Meet 48-year-old Adama from Masuba, in the northern area of Sierra Leone. She is married with five children. In 1981, Adama established her wood business. She began her business because she wanted to create a way to take care of her children. She works at the business 12 hours per day, 6 days per week. She says that her major problem in her business is the poor road network because sometimes vehicles break down on the way.   .
