Juliet is a 45-year-old woman from Antequera, Bohol. She is married with four children. Her eldest child is 25 and the youngest is 10. She operates a sari-sari store to help her husband who is a carpenter and a farmer. 

In her store, Juliet sells items like coffee, canned goods, eggs, detergent, milk, sugar and snack foods. She is asking for a loan to buy more stock of sugar, coffee, canned goods, eggs and noodles. The loan enable her to add more inventory before she runs out of stock. Her income will pay for healthy meals and school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, coffee, canned goods, eggs and noodles

loans.name: Germana

texts.en:
Germana is a 51-year-old married woman from Antequera, Bohol. She has two adult children. She is engaged in the buying and selling of bermuda grass. The bermuda grass is something that has been grown by other people which she buys and sells for a profit. The grass is used to decorate and used for landscape purposes. Aside from this business, she raises hogs. She earns 5,000 PHP a month from both businesses. 

Germana has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP for additional capital to buy more bermuda grass and feed. Germana would like to maximize her income by venturing into other businesses.

loans.use: to buy more bermuda grass and feed

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy, 49 years old, is from Naivasha and is married with four children who are in school.

Nancy has a dairy farming business that she has been running for the past three years. She has applied for her first loan from Vision Fund Kenya to enable her buy animal feeds and concentrates.

She hopes to be a prominent dairy farmer in the near future and be able to produce 100 litres of milk, up from the 20 litres that she currently gets.

loans.use: To buy animal feed and concentrates.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a married man with 2 children. He describes himself as very honest and resilient. He operates a tailoring business where he makes clothes for sale. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. The business is located in a secure area and his primary customers are local residents. 

Samuel describes his biggest business challenge as a lack of funds to buy materials. He will use the loan of 50,000 KES to buy fabric, thread, and other tailoring materials. His business goal is to expand within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will achieve his dreams. 

This is Samuel's third loan with SMEP DTM. Previous loans were paid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, and other tailoring materials.

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Asia is 27 years old, married and runs a cattle-farming business. She has been doing this business for many years with the support of her husband. She has one buffalo and one calf. She looks after her cattle and her husband supports her in selling the cattle in the market. They are happily doing it together to support their family.

She has five children. One of her children is shown in the photo. She needs to earn much more to meet their everyday expenditures including food, clothing and education. In order to make huge profits, Asia requested a loan of Rs 60,000 to buy one more buffalo. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: To buy one more buffalo

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Meet 39-year-old Marie from Magburaka, Makeni in the northern area of Sierra Leone. She is married with three children. Fifteen years ago, Marie established her plastic slippers business. She began her business because she wanted to generate a permanent source of income. She works at the business for 10 hours per day and six days per week.  She says that the main challenge to her business is price inflation and insufficient capital to expand her business.

Marie requires a loan in order to purchase more plastic slippers for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business. In the future, Marie plans to expand her business more than ever. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more plastic slippers for resale.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is 37 years old, married and, together with her husband, blessed with two children who are in school.

She has a farming business in Naivasha Sakutiek area, which she has practiced for eleven years, and also has a retail shop. She has applied for her first loan from VisionFund Kenya to enable her to buy fertilizer and also stocks of flour, rice, sugar among other items for her retail shop. With the anticipated profit, she plans to pay school fees.

In the near future, she hopes to apply for bigger loans from VisionFund Kenya to enable her to prosper in her farming and retail businesses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and also stocks of flour, rice, sugar, among other items, for her business.

loans.name: Latafat

texts.en:
Latafat is a 39-year-old married woman with 2 sons and a daughter. She is IDP and lives with her family in a settlement for IDP. Her husband is a laborer. She has a husbandry breeding cows, sheep, etc., and has been selling meat, milk, and wool for almost 10 years. Her monthly income is 100 AZN. 

There are lots of different kinds of delicious dishes in Azerbaijan cuisine that include meat (dolma, kebab, dushbere, qutab, khash). And that's why people's demand for meat is very high. Milk is also used daily, preparing different sweets (cookies, pies, etc.). Beside that milk is very useful for health. 

Latafat's condition is very difficult and she needs to increase her income and help her family. She applied for a loan of 2000 AZN in order to buy more husbandries. This is her fifth loan and she has a positive client history.

loans.use: to buy more husbandries.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 43 years old, single, and a mother of two children aged 16 and 11 years old.

She has a retail shop in Naivasha which she has been running for two years, and has applied for her second loan from VisionFund Kenya to enable her buy stock, such as sugar, rice, and other items, for her business. With the anticipated profit, she plans to pay school fees for her children.

In the near future, she hopes to own a supermarket.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice and other items for her retail shop.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Stella is a married woman. She has one child. She describes herself to be social. She operates a chemist where she sells medicine. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a residential area and her primary customers are all types of people. She describes her biggest business challenges to be price changes and government legislation concerning certain drugs. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to add to her stock of medicine. Her business goal is to start other businesses within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will buy a piece of land and educate her children. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to add to her stock of medicine

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is 39 years old, married to Eunice, and together they are blessed with five children who are in school.

He has a hotel business in Naivasha, which he has been running for the past ten years. He has applied for his first loan from VisionFund Kenya to enable him to buy flour and other hotel items. With the anticipated profit, he plans to pay school fees.

In the near future, he hopes to expand his business to be among the leading hotels in Naivasha.

loans.use: to buy flour and other hotel items.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah, 21 years old, is from Naivasha. She is a single lady. 

Hannah has a grocery business that she has been running for the past two years. She has applied for her first loan from Vision Fund Kenya of KES 10,000, which will enable her to buy onions, tomatoes, vegetables etc to add to her stock for sale.

She hopes to improve her standard of living in the near future.

loans.use: To buy onions and tomatoes

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 43 years old from Naivasha and is married. She has four children who are aged between 24 and 8 years old.

Alice has a livestock business that she has been running for many years. She has applied for her first loan from Vision Fund Kenya to enable her to buy chicken to boost her poultry business which is her secondary business.

She hopes to improve the standard of living of her family in the near future.

loans.use: to buy chicken to boost her poultry business.

loans.name: Mauricia

texts.en:
Mauricia is 49 years old and lives in Cortes, Bohol. She is married with four children. Her eldest child is 24 and her youngest is 17. She likes to help her husband, who is a farmer, in raising their family. Mauricia helps by raising chickens in her chicken coop. She has been in this business for seven years. 

Mauricia is asking for a loan to pay school fees for her children and to buy feed for the chickens. In the future, Mauricia hopes that she will be able to improve her business profits and develop other business opportunities so that she can better provide for her family.

loans.use: to pay for school fees and to buy chicken feed

loans.name: Mijahd

texts.en: Mijahd is a 48-year-old married man who has five children and lives in Sana`a, Yemen. He has run a grocery store for one year and earns a low daily income. He works really hard and lives in a poor area. He said that he couldn`t provide for his family`s needs permanently due to his business not running well. He would like to expand his business. He applied for a loan of 70,000 YER from AMB to buy new products for his grocery store in order to expand his business. In the future, he hopes to improve his living standards so he could apply his increased profits to his family’s needs.

loans.use: to buy new products for his grocery store in order to expand his business.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Meet 32-year-old Kadiatu from Magburaka, Makeni in the northern area of Sierra Leone. She is married with five children. Eighteen years ago, Kadiatu established her plastic slippers business. She began her business because she wanted to contribute to taking care of her children. She works at the business for 10 hours per day and six days per week.  She says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and insufficient capital to expand her business.

Kadiatu requires a loan in order to purchase more plastic slippers for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business. In the future, Kadiatu plans to expand her business more than ever. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more plastic slippers for resale.

loans.name: Memunatu

texts.en:
Meet 38-year-old Memunatu from Magburaka Makeni, Northern area in Sierra Leone. She is married with 4 children. 

In 2008, Memunatu established her vendor medical drugs business. She began her business because there was a high rate of health problems within the community. She works at the business for 13 hours per day, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is that she sometimes finds it very difficult to go door to door to introduce her goods.

Memunatu requires a loan in order to purchase more medical drugs for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to repay her loan and increase her business. In the future, Memunatu plans to expand to a big pharmacy. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more medical drugs for resale.

loans.name: Daru  Martina

texts.en: Daru Martina is 35 years old, the married mother of five children. Four of the children go to school. She learned about Finance South Sudan through friends. She is a businesswoman who operates a cereal stall in the open market in Nimule Town, South Sudan. She has been in this business for about 10 years. Daru Martina is borrowing 500 SSP (South Sudanese Pounds) to help her buy more cereals, including beans, rice and many others, to sell. She says the loan will also help her pay school fees for her children and feed the family.

loans.use: to buy cereals, including beans and rice, to sell.

loans.name: Vasif

texts.en:
Vasif is 29 years old, married and has one daughter. His family is an IDP (internally displaced person) and they live in an IDP settlement. His wife is a housekeeper.  Vasif raises vegetables (greens, potatoes, onions, tomatoes and so on) and fruit trees (apples, pears and etc.). His monthly income is 150 AZN and he has nine years of experience in this field . He gets an additional small income working as a driver.

People living in DIP settlements have a higher demand for products such as fresh fruits and vegetables. They prepare juice, fruit pies, etc. and make different kinds of salads. 

Vasif needs to improve the condition of his garden. He applied for a 2,000 AZN loan to buy garden tools and repair the garden. He wants to get more money in order to improve his family's hard life.

loans.use: to buy garden tools and repair his garden

loans.name: Teofie

texts.en:
Teofie is a 40-year-old married man from Cortes, Bohol. He has been making candles for three years now in order to provide for his family. He has a daughter aged nine whom he wishes to send to school until college. He also raises hogs for additional income. Teofie is asking for a loan of 13,000 PHP to buy materials for candle-making, like wax, bamboo sticks, thread, mold and feed for the pigs.

In the future, Teofie would like to expand his business and have a bigger piggery to better support his family.

loans.use: to buy materials for candle-making, like wax, bamboo sticks, thread, mold and feed for the pigs.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a male Ugandan, aged 41. He is married with 7 children. Four of his children attend school and he pays tuition and provides all the other basic needs for them. John sells used clothing in the outskirts of a village trading centre in Kibale district and also grows coffee as another source of income. He has approached UGAFODE for a loan UGX.800,000,000 to add more stock in his business of old clothes so that he can increase his profits. His main challenge is competition from other traders who have more capital than him. John describes himself as a hardworking and honest business person.

loans.use: to buy second hand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Gulsara

texts.ru:
Гулсара жительница города Душанбе. Она 40-летняя замужняя женщина, имеющая троих детей. Муж является рабочим, а дети учатся в школе. Гулсара добрая, отзывчивая и трудолюбивая женщина. Она трудится наравне мужа. 
Вот уже 7 лет как она занимается швейным делом. Гулсара работает у себя дома. Она отвела специальное место для деятельности. Гулсара шьет национальные женские платья и у нее всегда получаются красивые фасоны. Теперь она решила расширить свое дело и с такой целью берет кредит, чтобы купить новую модернизированную швейную машинку. Благодаря новой машинке ее работа облегчится и она сможет шить быстрее и к тому же качественнее. Гулсара ждет поддержки.
texts.en: Gulsara is a resident of the city of Dushanbe.  She is a 40 year-old married woman, who has three children.  Her husband is a worker, and children attend a school.  Gulsara is a kind, responsive and hardworking woman.  She works just as hard as her husband.  She has been involved in a sewing business for 7 years now.  Gulsara works at home.  She set a designated place for her business.  Gulsara sews national women's dresses and always makes nice fashions.  Now she decided to expand her business and is requesting a loan to purchase a new, modern sewing machine.  Thanks to the new machine, her work would be easier and she would sew quicker and with better quality.  Gulsara is awaiting the support.

loans.use: to purchase a new, modern sewing machine

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is married with five children, none of whom goes to school. She also supports her young sister. The family lives in a rental and has access to electricity but no piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees for her sister and rent.

For the past five years Irene has operated a beauty salon where she also sells hair products. She works in her shop six days a week. Thieves and seasonality are business challenges for her.

Irene has applied for a 1,100,000 UGX loan through MCDT-SACCO to buy more boxes of cream relaxers, weaves, braids and other cosmetics. Her goal is to own a fully-stocked beauty salon as well as buy a plot of land and build her own house.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of cream relaxers, weaves, braids and other cosmetics

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is a 45-year-old married lady, and supports a family of twelve members. Her children are aged between five and twenty years of age. She has been running a retail shop in the outskirts of Narok town, Kenya, for the last four years with a monthly income of 10,000 KES. 

Teresa learnt about Vision fund from one of her regular store customers. She has been advanced her first loan of 20,000 KES, which will facilitate her in purchasing additional consumables in bulk for her retail shop. 

She plans to use the increased proceeds to provide for her family's basic needs. Her dream is to educate her children, thus improving the family's living standards. The client photo was taken with two of her children who were in her shop when the officer was meeting the client.

loans.use: to buy more inventory of goods like sugar, and both wheat flour and maize flour for sale

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 42 years old, married to Benson, and together they are blessed with nine children who are in school.

She is in the farming business in the Naivasha area, which she has practiced for 20 years, and she has applied for her first loan from VisionFund Kenya to enable her to buy fertilizer and seeds. She will use the anticipated profit from expanded business to pay school fees for her children.

In the near future, she hopes to own the biggest farm in the area.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a man of 36 years who is married to Racheal and the father of two children. He sells timber and firewood on the outskirts of Limuru. He has been in this business for 10 years now and gets a monthly income of 13,000 shillings.

This will be Daniel's seventh loan with VisionFund Kenya. He plans to use the entire loan to buy timber. In the future, he wants to expand his business and educate his children.

loans.use: To buy wood for resale

loans.name: Chrispinus

texts.en:
Chrispinus is a 42-year-old married man with five children, ages 13, seven, four, two, and one.

He has been a car mechanic for 25 years and his monthly income is 40,000 KES.  He has requested for his fourth loan of 80,000 KES to purchase equipment which will be used to service vehicles that come to his car garage. 

He plans to educate his children with the anticipated profits and he hopes to have a better and fulfilled life in future.

loans.use: to purchase materials for his vehicle repair business.

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel, 49 years old, is from Nakuru and very industrious. She is married to Philip and blessed with four children who are 18, 21, 24 and 26 years old.

She operates as an herbal medicine seller. She earns a monthly income of KES 10,000 and has been in the business for six years. She has applied for her first loan of KES 30,000 from VisionFund Kenya. She plans to use her loan to buy more stock of herbal medicine for sale.

She anticipates to use her monthly income to pay her loan and boost her business. In the future, she hopes to expand her business and buy a plot.

loans.use: To buy more stock for her hebal business.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en: Annet lives in Hoima, Uganda. She is 34 years old. She is married with a responsibility of taking care of two children. She has been dealing in rice selling since 2008 so as to improve her family welfare. She is a hardworking woman, who desires to expand her business into new markets. However, fluctuating prices affect her business. She dreams of expanding her business. She is acquiring a loan to buy more rice to sell.

loans.use: to buy rice to sell.

loans.name: Badru

texts.en:
Badru, 34 years old, is a resident of a suburb in Lugala-Rubaga division. He has two children who both attend school.

He has a motorcycle transport business called “BODA BODA” (motorcycle riding) which he started three years ago. With this business he has been able to buy a small piece of land but still he’s ambitious to create another source of income.
However, Badru has a challenge of lack of enough funds to help him start another business, which would increase his income.  This would improve his standard of living and educate his children. 

Therefore Badru is requesting for financial support of one million shillings (1,000,000 UGX) in order to set up a retail shop so as to create other sources of income. He intends to buy daily household use items such as sugar, salt, soap, posho, rice among other items that he will sell to the community around him. Badru is a hardworking and dedicated person.

loans.use: to buy daily household use items such as sugar, salt, soap, posho, rice among other items that he will sell to the community around him

loans.name: Obama 3 Group

texts.en:
Fred (in blue shirt) is a 42-year-old member of the Obama 3 group.  He is married with four children ages 15, 14, 10 and 7 and all of them attend school.

Fred deals in the hiring out of motorcycles to different individuals.  In addition, he works at a bakery in order to earn more income.  Fred wants a loan to purchase more motorcycles for hiring out.  Fred is a hardworking and honest gentleman.  The lady in a red blouse at the back (right) is the Ugafode credit officer.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Symbat

texts.ru: Сымбат 43 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 2 детей. У Сымбат - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Сымбат занимается животноводством, стартовав 18 лет назад, с покупки скота на 5,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Сымбат, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 дойные коровы, 1 бычок. Ежемесячный доход составляет 11,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Сымбат обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку коровы для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Сымбат планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на покупку семейной автомашины.
texts.en: Symbat is 43 years old, married and raising 2 children together with her husband.  Symbat has a secondary education. To provide the primary income for her family, she is involved in animal husbandry, having started 18 years ago with a purchase of livestock with 5,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Symbat's hard work, today her business contains 3 dairy cows and 1 bull. The monthly income amounts to 11,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, Symbat requested a loan from the microfinance bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" to buy a cow in order to increase livestock headcount. Symbat plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing domestic livestock quantities and saving money to buy a family car.

loans.use: to buy a cow in order to increase livestock headcount

loans.name: Khannorjin

texts.en:
Mrs. Khannorjin, 27 years old, lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been rendering sewing services to local people since 2012. Previously, she ran a kiosk from 2007 to 2012. Her husband is a self-employed interior designer. Their oldest child goes to kindergarten while the youngest one stays at home. 

Mrs. Khannorjin is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to buy a sewing machine, because the sewing machine she uses now has deteriorated badly. The new sewing machine will allow her to increase her productivity and contribute more to the family's income. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Nuridin

texts.en:
Nuridin was born in 1965. He is married and has 4 children. Nuridin has been busy with animal husbandry for more than 5 years. He feeds cows. He has a big cowshed. He has developed his business little by little. Nuridin has regular customers. He is going to continue to develop his business. 

He is asking for a loan of 10,000 somoni to buy cattle. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy cattle to sell.

loans.name: Niso

texts.en: Niso is 53 years old. She is a widow and has a daughter named Mehrangis, who is not an adult. Niso has her own business with sewing. She works in a workshop, which is located near her house. Niso sews national women's dresses. Niso has regular customers, thanks to good service. She is going to organize a party, but she has no money. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 TJS to organize a party. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to organize a party.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en: Thanks to you,Valentina was able to install windows and doors to her family home with the previous loan. Now, she needs your help again to finish the roofing of one room.

loans.use: to finish the roofing of one room

loans.name: Ivy

texts.en:
Ivy hails from the town of Panglao, Bohol. She raises and sells pigs to meet her daily living expenses. Her business started more than two years ago. She is asking for a loan to buy pig feed and an additional piglet to increase the number of pigs sold and gain more income.

In the future, Ivy hopes to expand her hog-raising business and increase business profitability for a sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and a piglet

loans.name: Mayrambi

texts.ru: Майрамби из района Рудаки является активной, целеустремленной и упорной женщиной в возрасте 57 лет. Она в душе повар-кондитер. Майрамби занимается собственным бизнесом - производством карамельных яблок, всеми любимых лакомством, особенно детей. Она начала данный бизнес 5 лет назад и успешно продвигает его по сей день. В деятельности ей помогает сын. Он на своей машине отвозит готовую продукцию на рынок для продажи. В данный момент Майрамби занимается данным делом у себя дома, но в будущем она хочет открыть свой маленький цех по производству карамельных яблок. Чтобы достичь этой цели ей необходимо расширить бизнес. Она просит кредит чтобы закупить сахар и яблок для производства большего количества яблок в карамели. Она надеется на Вашу отзывчивость и с нетерпением ждет поддержки.
texts.en: Mayrambi, from the Rudaki district, is an active, driven and persistent, 57 year-old woman.  She is a cook-confectioner in her soul.  Mayrambi is involved in her own business - making caramel apples, loved by everyone, especially children.  She started this business 5 years ago and successfully runs it to this day.  Her son helps her with the business.  He delivers prepared products to a market for sale.  At the present time, Mayrambi is involved in this business at home, but in the future wants to open her own small factory to make caramel apples.  She has to expand her business to achieve this goal.  She is requesting this loan to purchase sugar and apples for making a large quantity of caramel apples.  She hopes for Your responsiveness and anxiously awaits support.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and apples for making a large quantity of caramel apples

loans.name: Iroda

texts.ru: Ирода молодая, красивая, жизнерадостная девушка. Она очень целеустремленная . Ей 22 года. Замужем. Мать двоих прекрасных малышей. Ирода заботливая мамочка и любящая жена. Муж Ироды уехал в Россию на заработки. Сама Ирода вот уже несколько лет подряд занимается продажей продуктов питания на рынке. Ирода начинала свой бизнес с малого оборота, товары привозила  понемножку. На сегодняшней день её бизнес развивается хорошо, клиентура у Ироды достаточна. Она в данное время расширила ассортимент продуктов,начала заказывать товары с города. Ирода давняя клиентка МДО "Арванд". Она очень рада что сотрудничает с такой организацией, ведь благодаря МДО "Арванд" она всегда может рассчитывать на поддержку с материальной стороны. И вот в очередной раз Ирода подала заявку на кредит для своего товарооборота. На полученный кредит Ирода планирует купить продукты питания. Ирода заранее выражает свою благодарность за доверие и финансовую поддержку.
texts.en: Iroda is a young, beautiful and happy young woman.  She is very driven.  She is 22 years old, married and a mother of two beautiful toddlers.  Iroda is a caring mother and a loving wife.  Iroda's husband went to Russia for work.  Iroda has been involved in selling food products at a market for several years in a row.  Iroda started her business with a small turnover and brought merchandise a little at a time.  Today, her business is developing well, and Iroda has enough customers.  At the present time, she expanded the selection of products and started to order products from the city.  Iroda is a long-time client of MDO "Arvand."  She is very happy to be working with such an organization because thanks to MDO "Arvand" she can always count on financial support.  And yet another time, Iroda is requesting a loan for her product turnover.  Iroda plans to use this loan to purchase food products.  Iroda expresses her gratitude for the trust and financial support in advance.

loans.use: to purchase food products

loans.name: Saima

texts.en:
Saima is a 26-year-old married woman and a mother of three children. She is a hardworking and independent mother who is helping her family by providing tailoring services at her home. She has been doing it for the past four years. She knows stitching techniques very well. She sews garments of ladies in her town. She earns enough to lead a decent life. 
To help her continue operations of her business, she requested a loan to buy some spools of threads, cloths, buttons and needles, so she would be able to meet the demands of her customers. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses. Saima thanks to Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy spools, reels, packs of zipper, buttons etc. for tailoring

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en: Avelina is a 50-year-old woman from Cabawan, Tagbilaran City. She is married and has an eight year old child. Her husband is a carpenter, but sometimes does not have work. Avelina has a small Sari-sari store where she sells canned goods, snacks, cooking oil, detergent and noodles. Avelina is requesting a loan to increase her inventory through the purchase of items such as canned goods, shampoo, detergent, chips and cooking oil. The loan will give her a chance to replenish sold items. Avelina is optimistic that she will be more successful in her business with the help of her loans. Her income provide food and school fees for her child.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, shampoo, detergent, chips and cooking oil for sale

loans.name: Hani

texts.en: Hani is a 25-year-old single man. He lives in Sana`a, Yemen. He has a secondary school education. He has a grocery store where he sells food and daily home goods. He previously opened a small cafeteria in school sold it to establish a grocery store. Recently, Hani's business has faced financial challenges leading to a decrease in his profit. He has stopped providing people's requirements because of the current bad situation that Yemen has been facing. He is requesting a loan of 60,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase grocery goods to continue supplying clients' requests. In the future, he is planning to expand his groceries so that increase his profit.

loans.use: to purchase grocery goods for his store

loans.name: Edith

texts.es:
Edith tiene 26 años, está casada con Raúl y tiene 2 hijos que viven junto a ella en su vivienda hecha a base de adobes. Se dedica hace mas de 8 años a la producción agrícola de distintos productos de su localidad como es el cacao orgánico, achiote, barbasco; entre otros que son considerados los mas rentables de su localidad.
Posee un terreno de 3 hectáreas siendo inicialmente propietaria de una hectárea que sus padres le cedieron al tener su primer hijo y logrando adquirir el área restante con el fruto de sus ganancias. Realiza sus tareas agrícolas con la ayuda de su esposo. Con el objetivo de obtener cosechas con una calidad comercial suele usar únicamente abono orgánico. Es el primer préstamo que solicita a Kiva  y se siente muy agradecida por la oportunidad que le brindan para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Desea en esta oportunidad contar con 1,500 nuevos soles para la compra de abono orgánico y así brindarle un buen mantenimiento a sus plantaciones de cacao orgánico.
texts.en: Edith is 26 years old and married to Raúl, with whom she has two children. They live together in a brick home. She has made a living in farming for more than eight years, growing the distinct products of her area, such as organic cocoa, annatto and barbasco, which are the most lucrative. She has three hectares of land. She started out with one hectare that her parents gave her when she had her first son and was able to acquire the remainder with her profits. She carries out her farming work with the help of her husband. With the goal of obtaining harvests of commercial quality, she only uses organic fertilizer. This is her first request for a Kiva loan, and she feels very grateful for the opportunity to make progress. Furthermore, she promises to make her payments on time. She plans to use the loan to purchase organic fertilizer and thus provide her cocoa crops with good care.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer for her crops.

loans.name: Samandar

texts.en: Samandar is hardworking man. He is 19 years old. Samandar is a student of his first course and studies at the Tajikistan State University Ozody. He learns the Chine language. Samandar is going to be a teacher of the Chine language. Samandar studies well. He is one of the best students of the University. Samandar has a good ability for learning foreign languages. Samandar must to pay for tuition. He is asking for a loan of 700 USD to pay for tuition. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To pay for tuition for a university course.

loans.name: Temistocles

texts.en: 44-year-old Temistocles has been in the business of raising pigs and operating a Sari-sari store (convenience store) for 5 years now. She is from Sikatuna, Bohol. She is asking for a loan to buy additional stocks of canned sardines, noodles, eggs, snack food, candies and sugar. She works hard for her two children and tries to help her husband who is a carpenter. She hopes to continue making her business thrive so she can uplift their living status and renovate their home.

loans.use: to buy canned sardines, noodles, eggs, snack food, candies and sugar.

loans.name: Teofreda

texts.en:
Teofreda is 43 years old. She is from Sikatuna, Bohol. Teofreda is married with two children who are still dependents. She is currently engaged in making furniture together with her husband. Her business started 4 years ago. She has many plans for her business but can only act on them late because of financial limitations. Teofreda is asking for a loan to buy hardwood so she can accept more orders. She is aiming to have a bigger business so she can provide better for her family, especially her children's education and family daily consumption. 

In the future, she hopes to expand her business to increase profitability.

loans.use: to buy hardwood.

loans.name: Arlita

texts.en:
Arlita works hard to support her family. Arlita is married and has a handicraft business in the Philippines.

Arlita requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials like wire, shells, nylon thread, etc. for her business.

Arlita has been in this business for 12 years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Arlita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like wire, shells, nylon thread, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Belen

texts.en:
Belen is 53 years old and married with two children. Belen works very hard to provide for them.

Belen runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items like canned goods, eggs, soft-drinks, milk, juice, etc. to sell.

Belen has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, eggs, soft-drinks, milk, juice, etc. 

Belen would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items like canned goods, eggs, soft-drinks, milk, juice, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Bella Monalisa

texts.en:
Bella Monalisa works hard to support her family. Bella Monalisa is married and has a handicraft business in the Philippines.

Bella Monalisa requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy more raw materials like shells, wire, scissors, nylon thread, etc. for her business.

Bella Monalisa has been in this business for 14 years now.

In the future, Bella Monalisa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more raw materials like shells, wire, scissors, nylon thread, etc. for her business

loans.name: Shahriyar

texts.en:
Shahriyar is a 24-year-old single man. He is refugee and lives in IDP (Internally Displaced Persons) settlement. He is a farmer and grows fruit trees and sells fruits at the local bazaar for almost 3 years now. His monthly income is 100AZN and this is not enough for him to make his hard life better. That’s why he works additionally as a laborer when he has time.

Fresh fruit is very good for people’s health because they include lots of vitamins. People know this and buy fruit more often than other foods and products. They prepare different sweets, jams, etc with the fruit.

The condition of Shahriyar’s garden is very bad. Because of the rainy climate in that region, his harvest dies and he can’t sell enough fruit to cover his demands. He applied for 2000AZN loan in order to buy garden tools and make small green-house for his trees.

loans.use: to make small green-house for his trees.

loans.name: Soutoura Group

texts.fr:
SOUTOURA est un groupe de l’association MINATATON de KELEYA. Il regroupe  4 femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans. Mariées avec en moyenne cinq enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente de condiments et de  riz à l’image de MARIAM  qui est la première personne de la gauche vers la droite de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à KELEYA dans la  préfecture de BOUGOUNI (Région de SIKASSO, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leur clientèle, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur neuvième prêt solidaire. 
MARIAM, qui est la présidente du groupe et très connue à KELEYA, excelle dans la vente de riz. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, quelques sacs de riz.  Elle s’approvisionne dans les villages environnants et sur place auprès des grossistes  et effectue ses ventes à KELEYA, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 30.000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et de réinvestir dans son activité.
texts.en:
"Soutoura" is a group in the Minataton de Keleya association, which is made up of four women who know each other from family and neighborhood ties. They are, on average, 38 years old. Married with an average of five children, they do different things for a living, especially though the buying and selling of condiments and rice, like Mariam, who is the first perosn standing on the left in the photo. They live in large traditional families in Keleya, in Bougouni prefecture (Sikasso region, Republic of Mali). They have been involved in small-scale commerce for several years and are very sought after in their business areas.

In order to satisfy the needs of their growing number of customers, the group members decided to join Soro Yiriwaso's loan program. They are on their ninth loan. 

Mariam, who is the president of the group and is very known in Keleya, excelles in the selling of rice. She plans to use her loan to buy some sacs of rice. She procures her goods in the surrounding villages and in town from wholesalers. She makes her sales in Keleya for cash and credit, to customers who are men and women. 

She hopes to earn a monthly profit of 30,000 francs CFA, which will allow her to repay the loan and to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy rice

loans.name: Heraclea

texts.en:
Heraclea hails from the town of Baclayon, Bohol. She is married with 4 grown children. She engages in the food vending business. Aside from food vending, she runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She is asking for a loan to buy more stocks for her store and additional ingredients for her food vending business.

In the future, Heraclea hopes to expand her both business and increase business profitability for sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to buy more stocks for her store and additional ingredients for her food vending business

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en: Jacinta is a 37-year-old married woman and a mother of four children from Cortes, Bohol, Philippines. Jacinta works at home by raising hogs. She finds this convenient so that she can also look after her children.Jacinta wanted to expand her business but lacks the financial resources to do so. She is asking for a loan to buy another piglet to raise and also some feed. Someday, she plans to make a bigger piggery and venture into other business opportunities so she can successfully send her children to school.

loans.use: to  buy a piglet and feed.

loans.name: Mohigul

texts.en: Mohigul is 23 years old. She is married but has no children. She is a hardworking woman and has always wanted to provide her family with a good quality of life. She decided to start a new business sewing the national dress for women as she is a good seamstress. With this aim, she studied at the course ‘To Get Ahead’ through a women's organization and gained enough skills about business.  Her husband will help her with the business. She will be a very successful business woman as she is hardworking and smart. She is asking for a loan of 1000 Somoni to buy a sewing machine for organizing this new business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine to start new business.

loans.name: Epifania

texts.en:
Epifania is 54 year old food vendor from the town of Cortes, Bohol. She is married with five grown children. 
This has been her business for 16 years now. She is asking for a loan to buy soy sauce, cooking oil, meat and vegetables that she can cook. Epifania's husband works as a mechanic but she works hard so she can help him for their daily needs.  In the future, she hopes to expand her business and be more able to provide healthy meals and save for old age.

loans.use: to buy soy sauce, cooking oil, meat and vegetables

loans.name: Shabnam

texts.en: Shabnam was born in 1987. She lives with her family in Tajikistan. Shabnam is married and has 2 little children. Shabnam’s husband works in a financial organization. She does not have a high degree. She has always wanted to work somewhere or have her own business. She took part in a course titled ‘To Get Ahead’ from a women's organization and received a certificate. She decided to organize her own business with animal husbandry after how she took part in this course. Shabnam is asking for a loan of 1500 somoni to buy cattle. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy cattle to start a new business.

loans.name: Leyla

texts.en:
Leyla is a 57-year-old widow with a daughter and two sons. They are refugees and live in an IDP (Internally Displaced Persons) settlement. She grows vegetables and her elder son helps her with this. Then she sells them at the local bazaar and receives 150AZN monthly for this. She has 21 years of  experience in this work. 

Azerbaijan cuisine has lots of recipes for delicious dishes. People buy vegetables to prepare such dishes as dolma, badimjhan dolmasi, qovurma, sogan dolmasi, basdirma and so on. That’s why people's demand for vegetables (potatoes, tomatoes, onion, greens, eggplant) is high.

The situation for Leyla is very hard. She has to raise her children and provide them with a bright future. She applied for 2000AZN loan in order to buy more fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy new fertilizer.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Antonia is 40 years old and married with two children. With two children currently in school, Antonia works very hard to provide for them.

Antonia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy additional goods like canned goods, detergent soap, fabric conditioner, shampoo, coffee, seasonings, etc. to sell.

Antonia has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, detergent soap, fabric conditioner, shampoo, coffee, seasonings, etc. 

Antonia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional goods like canned goods, detergent soap, fabric conditioner, shampoo, coffee, seasonings, etc. to sell

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Avelina is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Avelina is 40 years old and has two children who are still in school.

Avelina has an egg vending business in the Philippines. Avelina requested a PHP 7000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional trays of eggs to sell.

Avelina has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Avelina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional trays of eggs to sell

loans.name: Bella Moreta

texts.en:
Bella Moreta is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Bella Moreta is 57 years old and has two children who are still in school.

Bella Moreta has a handicraft business in the Philippines. Bella Moreta requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her business.

Bella Moreta has been in this business for 13 years. In the future, Bella Moreta would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her business

loans.name: Bernardita

texts.en:
Bernardita is 42 years old and married with three children. With two children currently in school, Bernardita works very hard to provide for them.

Bernardita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell in her general store.

Bernardita has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items such as fabric conditioner, shampoo, canned goods, bath soap, coffee, dried fish, etc. 

Bernardita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell in her general store

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
Meet 55-year-old Aminata from Magburaka, Makeni Southern area in Sierra Leone. She is married with 8 children. In 1976, Aminata established her baking business. She began her business because she wants to help her husband take care of the children and other affairs in the home. She works at the business for 10 hours per day and six days per week.  She says that the main challenge to her business is price inflation and insufficient capital to expand her business.

Aminata requires a loan in order to purchase more flour, sugar, butter and general stock to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business. In the future, Aminata plans to expand her business more than ever. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more flour, sugar, butter and general stock to expand her business.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Meet 33 year old Marie from Magburaka, Makeni Northern area in Sierra Leone. She is married with three children. In 2000 she established her phone accessories business. She began her business because she wanted to improve her standard of living. She works at the business from 8am until 5.30pm six days per week. She says that her business is doing well.

Marie requires a loan in order to purchase more varieties of phone accessories to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her standard of living and increase her business. In the future, Marie plans to have a big shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more varieties of phone accessories to expand her business.

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en:
Beverly is 43 years old and married with four children.

Beverly works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell in her general store.

Beverly has borrowed and paid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from frozen foods vending.

Beverly aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell in her general store

loans.name: Charito

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Charito works hard to support her family.

She has a general store in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Charito is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to buy more items like shampoo, eggs, coffee, bath soap, hair conditioner and other groceries to sell for her general store.

Charito has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items like shampoo, eggs, coffee, bath soap, hair conditioner and other groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rahman

texts.en:
Rahman is 44 years old and married with a daughter and two sons. His wife is a housekeeper. They are refugees and live in a settlement for IDP (internally displaced peoples). Rahman has been raising husbandries for 12 years such as sheep and cows. He sells milk, meat and sheep's wool at the local bazaar and earns 130 AZN monthly.

The region where he lives is very cold. That’s why people's demand for wool is very high. They make coats, jackets, gloves and socks to keep themselves warm. People use meat to prepare dishes every day and drink milk because it is very useful for health.

Rahman wants to increase his income because his current earnings are not enough to cover life's demands. He applied for a 2,000 AZN loan in order to buy more animals.

loans.use: to buy more animals.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Meet 35-year-old Fatmata from Magburaka, Makeni Northern area in Sierra Leone. She is married with 1 child. In 2001, Fatmata established her clothing business. She began her business because she wants to generate income to support the home. She works at the business for 10 hours per day and six days per week.  She says that the main challenge to her business is price inflation and insufficient capital to expand her business.

Fatmata requires a loan to purchase a variety of clothing material for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to pay her children's school fees and increase her business. In the future, Fatmata plans to expand her business to a higher level. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of clothing material for resale.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Meet Kadiatu.  She is in her early forties and from Magburaka, Makeni Northern area in Sierra Leone. She is married with 2 children. In 1999, Kadiatu established her retail business.  She began her business because she wants to create a means of survival. She works at the business from 8:00am until 5:30 pm, 6 days per week. She says that her business is doing well.

Kadiatu requires a loan in order to purchase cigarette, drinks and soap to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business. In the future, Kadiatu plans to open a big provisions store. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase cigarette, drinks and soap to expand her business.

loans.name: Özlem

texts.en:
Özlem is married and has a son and a daughter. She opened a store in the local shopping district in order to stand on her own feet. She sells traditional women’s clothing and accessories.

Business is good in summer. Locals and foreign tourists buy her products. With the loan, she wants to buy products to increase her sales. Because she has a wide social circle, she doesn’t just stay at her shop but also sells to friends and relatives at their workplaces.

She began her career at 37. She wants to make her shop the flagship and open branches to expand her business. She feels she has proven herself in the short term over the last year. She wants to prepare a good future for her two children.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 
Özlem Hanım evli ve bir kız bir erkek çocuk annesi.  Kendi ayakları üzerinde durmak için  çarşıda bayan giyim üzerine küçük bir dükkan açıyor.  Otantik bayan giysileri ve aksesuarları satıyor.  Yazın işleri güzel gidiyor.  Yerli ve yabancı turistlere satış yapıyor.  Aldığı kredi ile dükkanına mal alarak satışlarını arttırmak istiyor. Çevresi geniş olduğu için sadece dükkanda kalmıyor, arkadaş ve akraba günlerine iş yerlerine giderek  ürünlerini satıyor.  37 yaşından sonra çalışma hayatına başlamış.  Dükkanını merkez yaparak ve şubeler açarak işlerini genişletmek istiyor.  Kendisini bir yıl gibi kısa bir sürede ispatlamış.  İki çocuğuna iyi bir gelecek hazırlamak istiyor.

loans.use: to buy products to increase her sales.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: Judith lives in Nanyuki, the central province in Kenya. She is 26 years old. She is a business lady as well as a farmer. She knew Milango through friends who asked her to join them so that they could save and be able to access funding for their businesses. She now seeks a loan to stock her retail shop with flour, sugar and rice. She hopes that in the next five years, she will be running a successful wholesale business. The challenges that she faces in the business include a lack of capital and competition. The extra income that she will raise will improve her standards of living.

loans.use: to stock her retail shop with flour, sugar and rice.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Meet 25- years old Isatu from Magburaka, Northern area in Sierra Leone. She is married to a security man but his income is not enough to take care of the home. Five years ago, Isatu established her food stand business.  She began her business because she wants training with the business. She works at the business 11 hours per day, 6 days per week. She says that her business is doing well.

Isatu requires a loan in order to purchase more groundnut and palm oil for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to take care of her family welfare and increase her business. In the future, Isatu plans to expand her business more than ever. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more groundnut and palm oil for resale.

loans.name: Hatice

texts.en:
Hatice is married with two children.  She works from home selling linen and women’s clothing.  Because she has many acquaintances, she has sold a lot at home. For about 10 years, she has contributed to the family income. She heard about Maya from a friend who had taken out a loan.  Hatice wanted to benefit from the opportunity as well.  With the loan from Maya, she’ll buy more products. Selling the products, she’ll expand her business.  If her business grows, she dreams of opening her own store.  She wants to give her children a bright future this way.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 
Evli, 2 çocuk annesi.  Evinden iş yapıyor.  Çamaşır ve kadın giysileri satıyor.  Eşi dostu çok olduğu için günlerde ve evlerde satış yapıyor.  Yaklaşık 10 yıldır aile ekonomisine katkı sağlıyor.  Maya’yı daha önce kredi alan arkadaşlarından duymuş.  Hatice Hanım da bu olanaklardan yararlanmak istemiş.  Maya'dan aldığı kredi ile daha çok mal almak istiyor.  Malını sattıkça da , işini genişletmek istiyor.  İşini büyütürse kendi dükkanını açmayı hayal ediyor.  Böylece çocuklarına iyi bir gelecek hazırlamak istiyor.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell.

loans.name: Cheenee

texts.en:
Cheenee is 23 years old and has a live-in partner with one child. Cheenee works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell in her general store. Cheenee has been in this business for one year and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, candies, biscuits, juice, etc. 

Cheenee would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Ol's Group

texts.en:
Ol is a resident from Sa Ang district in Kandal province. He is a father blessed with four children, two of whom are in school. To cover the daily cost of living, his entire family relies on the rice-farming business and fish catching. His wife's job is working in a local factory in the area. He has been with this business for 24 years, and it has returned him about 26,400 KHR per day. The main challenge for his business is the low crop yield caused by insects. To overcome his challenge, he applied for a new loan with VisionFund, a Kiva partner. 

This is the fourth-cycle loan for Ol with VisionFund. The past loan, which he has repaid back with success, has enabled him to improve his living conditions at a gradual pace. For this cycle, he teams up with a group of three to get a new loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, he will use his loan portion to pay for plowing fees and to buy fertilizer, insecticide, plus rice seeds. He hopes to grow his rice on time with a good yield so that he can keep his kids in school.

loans.use: to pay for plowing fees, fertilizer, insecticide and seeds

loans.name: Eman

texts.en:
Eman is 32 years old; she lives with her husband and her five children in Gaza. They live with her husband’s family and her dream is to build a separate house.  

She has been selling clothes since 2010. Eman works hard to support her husband and to provide good living conditions for her children. She has asked Ryada for this loan to buy an electric generator and make new decorations for her shop, which will help her because the electricity in Gaza cut offs continuously.

Eman is very grateful to everyone who helps her to achieve success in her business with this loan.

loans.use: to buy an electric generator and make new decorations for her shop.

loans.name: Dolly

texts.en:
Dolly is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Dolly is 47 years old and has one child who is still in school.

She has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Dolly requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like rice, meat, vegetables and spices for her food-vending business.

Dolly has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like rice, meat, vegetables and spices for her food-vending business.

loans.name: Moderne Group

texts.fr:
Paul fait partie du groupe  Moderne et habite à  Rumonge. Il  a 34 ans et est marié à  Joselyne, une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 4 enfants,  âgés de  3 mois  à 6 ans, dont 1 étudie.  

Il fait le commerce de  boutique (haricot, riz, habits,..) depuis 3  ans. 

Il est à son deuxième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité d’articles de sa boutique (haricot, riz, habits,..) à revendre pour gagner plus.

Dans les prochaines années, il voudrait  acheter une parcelle pour construire une maison  et voir ses enfants  étudier.
texts.en:
Paul is a member of the Moderne group and lives in Rumonge. He is 34 years old and married to Joselyne, a farmer. Together they have four children, aged between 3 months and six years. One of the children is in school.  

Paul has been running a shop (selling beans, rice, clothing, etc.) for three years. 

This is his second loan from Turame. This KIVA loan will increase his capital and help him buy a large quantity of items for his shop (beans, rice, clothing, etc.), which he will resell in order to make more money.

In the years to come, Paul would like to buy a plot of land on which to build a house, as well as send his children to school.

loans.use: to increase his capital and buy a large quantity of items for his shop (beans, rice, clothing, etc.) to resell in order to make more money.

loans.name: San Agustin Emboscada Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado San Agustin Emboscada está en su ciclo número 1°  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante, se fijaron como meta el crecimiento de cada una, no solo en lo económico, sino también como personas.
Ilda forma parte de este grupo,  quien cuenta que entre sus actividades está el hacer sombreros de caranday, venta de chicharrón, y también cuenta que tiene una despensa, y es por medio de estos trabajos que ella demuestra sus ganas de superación y el querer salir adelante. Pide este préstamo ya que quiere materiales para seguir haciendo sus sombreros y también su chicharrón. Todas están agradecidas por esta oportunidad de crecimiento que reciben.
texts.en:
This group is called “San Agustin Emboscada” and is in its first cycle of the committee for women program, where they all work to help one another get ahead, not only financially, but as individuals.

Ilda is part of this group and she makes caranday hats, sells fried pork rinds, and also has a grocery store and it’s through these businesses that she demonstrates her desire to succeed.  She is asking for this loan to buy hat making supplies and also fried pork rind supplies.  They are all grateful for the opportunity to grow.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Sugra

texts.en:
Sugra is  married with two children. One of them is married, too, and the other finished medical college. She is working at a polyclinic. They are living in the Baku region. Sugra is a teacher at a personal vocational school. Here she teach the art of carpet-weaving to her students. She weaves different types of traditional carpets as “Palas”, “Cecim”, “Ladı”, “Kilim”, “Şəddə”, “Vərni” , “Zili”, “Sumax”, etc.

 Sugra learned this profession from her mother. It should be noted that this is their family tradition and Sugra wants to have followers in this profession. 

Today she needs a loan in the amount of 2300 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). With this loan she wants to buy looms for carpet-weaving, thread and natural colors of wool thread. She says she is thankful to Kiva and its lenders for their help.

loans.use: to buy looms for carpet-weaving and natural colors of wool thread

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled is a 32-year-old married man from Rafah city. He lives with his wife and one small little daughter in a small house in the city. Khaled works as an employee in a local firm where he gets a low income. This income is barely enough to cover all the family's needs. 

Khaled also works on his farm in the evenings and holidays. He uses greenhouses to insure a good quality for the crops. He plants seasonal fruits and vegetables and sell them in the local market.

He took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy the raw materials for building new greenhouses on his farm. By taking this loan. Khaled will be able to improve his farm and increase the productivity. Khaled appears in the photo at his farm.

loans.use: to buy the raw materials for building new greenhouses on his farm

loans.name: Mana Ida

texts.fr:
Mana Ida est une femme âgé(e) de 40 ans. Elle a 01 enfant.
Mana Ida travaille comme revendeuse d’huile de palme depuis 1989. Elle vend en gros et détail à ses clients à la maison et au marché et achète ses marchandises à l’intérieur du pays.
Mana Ida a requis son cinquième crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des bidons d’huile de palme.
Dans les prochaines années, Mana Ida voudrait devenir une grande commerçante. Les profits lui permettront de contribuer à l'épanouissement de la famille.
texts.en:
Mana Ida is 40 years old. She has one child.

Mana Ida has been selling palm oil since 1989. She conducts her sales from her home, wholesale and retail, and she buys her merchandise within the country.

Mana Ida has requested her fifth loan from WAGES in order to buy cans of palm oil.

In the years to come, Mana Ida would like to become a major trader. Her profits will help her family thrive.

loans.use: to buy palm oil for resale.

loans.name: Yawavi

texts.fr:
Yawavi est une femme âgée de 38 ans. Elle est mariée à un frigoriste et mère de famille.
Yawavi travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2007. Elle vend des produits de beauté et des pagnes pour tous clients au marché. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est de la rupture de stock.
Yawavi a requis son cinquiéme crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits de beauté et des pagnes. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Yawavi voudrait ouvrir une boutique au grand marché de Hédzranawoé. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit de participer au bien être de sa famille.
texts.en:
Yawavi is 38 years old. She is married to a refrigerator technician and they have children.

Yawavi has been working as a trader since 2007. She sells beauty products and cloth pagnes to all customers at the market. She buys her products in Lomé and works alone. At the moment, her main difficulty is ensuring a constant supply.

Yawavi has requested her fifth loan from WAGES in order to buy beauty products and cloth pagnes. She would like to reinvest in her business.

In the years to come, Yawavi would like to open a shop in the Hédzranawoé Grand Market. She says that with the profits, she would like to contribute to the wellbeing of her family.

loans.use: To buy beauty products and traditional cloth.

loans.name: Durenagracia

texts.en:
Durenagracia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

Durenagracia has been in this business for four years. She earns more income from selling frozen foods.

Durenagracia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Elena works hard to support her family. She has a handicrafts business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from her general store. Elena is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase more materials like nylon thread, wire, shells, etc. for her handicrafts business.

Elena has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more materials like nylon thread, wire, shells, etc. for her business

loans.name: Rema

texts.en:
Rema is a 26-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband owns a stall in which he sells the Holy Quran. Her husband’s stall is situated near a mosque in which the children learn and recite the Quran. He offers editions of the Holy Quran by various companies and translated editions also.

Rema's husband wants to grow his business and buy more copies of the Holy Quran to stock but does not have a sufficient amount to purchase them. Therefore, Rema requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy the Holy Quran and easily grow his income. Rema is very happy after taking this loan and praises the lenders who are taking an active part in helping her.

loans.use: To buy copies of the Quran and other religious articles for resale

loans.name: Elpedia

texts.en:
Elpedia works hard to support her family. She  is married and has an egg vending business in the Philippines. Elpedia has been in this business for three years now.

She requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy more trays of eggs to sell to her customers. In the future, Elpedia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more trays of eggs to sell to her customers

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Elvie is 37 years old and has four children who are in school.

Elvie has a purified drinking water business in The Philippines. Elvie requested a PHP 5000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more containers of purified drinking water to sell.

Elvie has been in this business for one year. In the future, Elvie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more containers of purified drinking water to sell.

loans.name: Porfirio

texts.es:
Porfirio, se decidió por otro crédito para provechas la temporada de fin de año por lo que comprara camisas pantalones de uniforme, ya que sus clientes también empiezan a prepararse para el inicio del año escolar.
Porfirio invirtió el crédito anterior en la compra de ropa, sus ventas aumentaron, y sus nuevos ingresos le permiten cumplir con sus compromisos económicos, él está enseñando a su sobrino a vender ropa, para que en un futuro se pueda independizar.
texts.en:
Porfirio has decided to apply for another loan to take advantage of higher demand at the end of the year. His customers are beginning to prepare for the start of the school year, so Porfirio will purchase shirts and pants for school uniforms. 

Porfirio invested his previous loan in the purchase of clothing, his sales went up, and the additional income allowed him to meet his financial commitments. He is teaching his nephew to sell clothes so that the boy can go into business for himself one day.

loans.use: comprara camisas pantalones de uniforme

loans.name: Ely Marcela

texts.es: Ely es una joven originaria de la ciudad de León, soltera y muy trabajadora. De 22 años de edad. Es estudiante de la carrera técnica médica en una de las universidades de la ciudad. Ella tiene muchas metas en la vida y una de esas es terminar su carrera para ser una profesional con éxitos. Solicita el crédito para poder pagar el curso de titulación, con el fin de realizar su sueño de obtener su licenciatura. Su plan futuro es ser una persona con una buena calidad de vida y con un buen empleo, logrando así, ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
Ely is a young woman from the city of León. She is single and hardworking. She is 22 years old and is studying a technical career at one of the universities in the city. She has many goals in life, and one of them is to finish her studies to become a successful professional.

She is asking for a loan to pay for the degree course, in order to realize her dream of earning her degree.

Her plan for the future is to be a person with a good quality of life and with a good job. By this she would be able to support her family

loans.use: to pay for her degree course.

loans.name: Luis Alonco

texts.es: Don Luis tiene 46 años de edad, es casado, tiene un hijo y vive en el municipio de Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara. Siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura, tiene aproximadamente 20 años de cultivar maíz y frijoles. Esta producción la vende en la misma zona. Ha decidido solicitar un préstamo por 20,000 lempiras para darle mantenimiento a sus cultivos, comprara fertilizantes para abonar el maíz y frijoles y sacar mejor cosecha. Su plan es mantener en buen estado sus cultivos, darles mejor calidad de vida a su familia y ser un buen agricultor.
texts.en:
Don Luis lives in the town of Azacualpa, in Santa Bárbara Department. He is 46 years old, married, and the father of a son. Don Luis has always been a farmer, and has grown corn and beans for approximately 20 years. He sells his crops in the Azacualpa area.

Don Luis has decided to apply for a loan of 20,000 lempiras to purchase fertilizers that will help him maintain his crops and improve his harvest. He has a plan to keep his crops healthy, be a successful farmer, and provide his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for corn and beans.

loans.name: Yeung's Group

texts.en: Residing in the Sa Ang district of Kandal Province, Yeung is 62 years old and a mother of seven children. She is a farmer who grows rice on around two and half hectares as the main source of income, and catches fish for resale as the supplementary income. These sources of her income earn her about 26,400 KHR per day. This is the second loan for Yeung with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has repaid her original loan with success and it has improved her livelihood better than before. She is now forming a group of two to get a new loan, and both of them are seeking the same loan amount of 1,000,000 KHR each. As a leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer, pesticide and rice seed for her farmland. She highly hopes that her crop will gain her more yield to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticide and rice seed for her farmland.

loans.name: Fwzy

texts.en: Fawzi is a 30-year-old who is a very active and ambitious man. He lives in Taiz, Yemen. His business was in water distribution, started when he got his first loan from Kiva. He was able to expand his business to establish a retail shop that sells fried foods. He says that he does very well with the business. He is working hard to continually provide income for the family's everyday expenses. He took out a third loan of 200,000 YER from AMB in order to buy food materials like flour, oil, potatoes, and salt etc.  He hopes the business will continue growing like it's done to date. He is grateful for Kiva lenders for financing his loan.

loans.use: to buy food materials like flour, oil, potatoes, and salt etc for his business.

loans.name: Elchin

texts.en:
Elchin is 43 years old, single and lives with his parents and sister in the Baku region.

His father has been sick for a long year. His mother is a housewife and his sister is a seller at a local market. Elchin provides all of the needs of the family, so he rents a salon and for 8 years he has been in the barbering business.

Today Elchin wants to increase his business and monthly income, therefore he needs a loan amount of 1,800 AZN (Azerbaijan new manat). With this loan, Elchin wants to repair a door and the windows of his salon. He says he is thankful to the Kiva organization and lenders for their help.

In the future, Elchin wants to buy this salon and will increase his monthly income. For his personal life, he wants to get married and to be the father of three children.

loans.use: to repair door and windows of his salon

loans.name: Tuyet Group

texts.en:
Hong was born in 1965. She lives in a rural area in the Bac Ninh province with her husband and two children. Hong has no dependants since both of her children have grown up and have stable jobs. Her husband is a skilled carpenter who has done this job for years. Hong runs her own retail business which is a grocery store for 15 years. The main hardship that Hong currently suffers is a lack of capital to develop her business. Thus, she is requesting a loan of VND 10,080,000 to purchase more stock to resell. With the profit from her business, Hong expects that she could save enough money to refurbish her house, enlarge her husband's carpentry workshop, and get marriages for her children.
Hong has successfully repaid six loans from the SEDA credit program. She is the leader of a group which consists of five members. Other members of Hong’s group are included in the following list:
•	Hoan was born in 1973. She has two children. She would love to borrow VND 10,080,000 to buy scrap metal to resell.
•	Ty was born in 1953. She has two children. She wants to borrow VND 10,080,000 raise chickens and sell in the future.
•	Thom was born in 1973. She would like to borrow VND 10,976,000 to invest in her business which is making and selling aluminium frames. 
•	An was born in 1960. She has three children. She works at a kindergarten as a cook. She wants to borrow VND 5,152,000 to raise pigs and sell in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to resell.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma hails  from the town of Lila, Bohol. She is married with two grown children. She engages in raising and selling hogs to help augment the income of their household. Her business started quite a few years ago. She is asking for a loan to buy  additional piglets and pig feed, to increase her sales.

In the future, Emma hopes to expand her hog raising business and increase business profitability for sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Emad

texts.en:
Emad is 23 years old and lives in Gaza. In 2012 he thought to do something to contributing to the family income as his parent’s income alone is not sufficient to fulfill the demands of all family members, so he started selling clothes at a stall on the street. He worked hard to improve his business. He is dreaming of providing good living conditions for his children’s future, as he wants them to have a better life than his life.

Emad is asking Ryada for this youth loan to buy a motorcycle to transport his goods to the local market. This will give him more time and less effort.
Emad is very grateful to everyone who helps him to achieve success in this business with this youth loan.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to transport his goods

loans.name: Florgie

texts.en:
Florgie is married with three children.  She is 43-years-old and lives in Cabol-anonan, Tudela, Philippines.

Florgie sells a variety of products in order to earn a living and has had this business for five years. Each month, she earns PHP 3,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 30,000 to restock her store with basic commodities such as shampoo, toothpaste, detergent, soap, etc.

Florgie has been a member of Kiva partner PMPC for four years.  In the future, Florgie hope to support her children's education.
